venue: Veggie Kingdom (Causeway Bay), 4/F, Kyoto Plaza 491-499 Lockhart Road, Causeway Bay, HKI, Hong Kong, Causeway Bay, HKI
description: Join us for Dine & Discover: Networking Night on Tuesday July 22, from 7:30 PM to 9:30 PM! This event aims to bring together the facilitation community and those interested in exploring this dynamic field. Whether you’re an experienced facilitator or just curious about the art of facilitation, this casual dinner is a perfect opportunity to connect, share insights, and learn from one another. Organized by International Association of Facilitators - Hong Kong Chapter (IAFHK), this evening will focus on fostering community ties and exchanging ideas. Attendees will cover their own meals, and registration is essential to secure your spot. With limited spaces available, we encourage you to register early. Please provide your phone number during registration for follow-up regarding reservations. Enjoy an enriching evening of conversation, collaboration, and community-building. We look forward to welcoming both newcomers and seasoned facilitators to this engaging gathering!

title: Discovering the Flavors of Vegan Thai Cuisine: A Private Cooking Class
summary: Embark on a culinary adventure with our exclusive private Vegan Thai class led by Chef Tina
venue: 葵芳, Room K2, 24/F, Block 1 Goldfield Industrial Building, 144 -150 Tai Lin Pai Road, NT, Hong Kong, 144 -150 Tai Lin Pai Road, NT
description: Embark on a culinary adventure with our exclusive private class, "Discovering the Flavors of Vegan Thai Cuisine," designed for individuals or small groups eager to learn the secrets of traditional Thai cooking while embracing a plant-based lifestyle. In this intimate cooking experience, you'll have the opportunity to work closely with Chef Tina, a talented chef who specializes in vegan Thai cuisine. Together, you'll discover essential Thai cooking techniques, including how to balance flavors, the importance of presentation, and tips for sourcing the best ingredients. You will also gain insights into the health benefits of a vegan diet and how to incorporate more plant-based meals into your everyday life. During this 3-hour class, you will experience how to make a variety of traditional Thai dishes using fresh, local ingredients. Chef Tina will guide you through the process of creating mouthwatering dishes like: After cooking, you can enjoy the delightful dishes you’ve prepared together! Share stories, savor the flavors, and connect with your fellow culinary enthusiasts in a warm and inviting atmosphere. This dining experience is the perfect way to celebrate your culinary creations and enjoy a meal that reflects the rich tapestry of Thai culture. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced cook, this class caters to all skill levels.

title: Discovery Space - Public Visits
summary: Pamela Peck Discovery Space 耀學園
venue: Yew Chung College of Early Childhood Education, 2 Tin Wan Hill Road, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Additional Information Welcome to the Pamela Peck Discovery Space! For public sessions, one booking (basic fee $100) covers 1 adult and 1 child only. *Please buy one more ticket for extra adult/ child. We are unable to accommodate walk-in visitors*. For guests holding a Friends of Discovery Space ticket, please book through the Friends of Discovery Space tab on the booking page with your unique FODS pass number. Pamela Peck Discovery Space is open for selective sessions from Mondays to Sundays: - Morning Session: 9:00 am – 12:00 pm - Afternoon Session: 1:00 pm – 4:00 pm If a specific session is not available for selection, the session is either full, blocked for a school excursion, internal event or deep cleaning & maintenance. Thank you! - --------------------------------------------------------------- Guidelines for Visitors at Pamela Peck Discovery Space (PPDS): In order to maintain a safe environment for all users of PPDS, visitors are requested to pay attention to the guidelines as follows: 1. Wearing of Masks Wearing of masks is not compulsory. Visitors are requested to wear mask should they have flu symptoms. 2. Consumption of Food and Drink Consumption of food and drink is discouraged. If children need to eat and/or drink, they should eat and/or drink at the outdoor picnic area. Please put rubbish in the litter bins provided. 3. Wearing Socks Adults are required to wear socks (no shoes allowed) in the indoor area. If necessary, you may approach the College Reception to purchase. 4. Safety of the Children Safety of the children is the primary responsibility of supervising parent(s)/carer(s) who accompany the children during the visit. Do not leave your children unattended. PPDS teachers are not in charge of children supervision. 5. Parent-Child Interaction Parent-child interaction is pivotal and the cornerstone of our work at PPDS, our teachers are here to facilitate activities and guide educational opportunities. 6. Visiting area of PPDS Use of PPDS is restricted to the ground floor facility, unless with express consent of the College. Visitors are not permitted to roam around the College. 7. Photography & Videography At Discovery Space we capture valuable moments during learning and produce a variety of different materials which we use to inform families, schools, and other organizations about the work that we do. The photographs/ videos may be used for promotional purpose to help us engage with other families, schools, and NGOs. 8. Fee/Refund Policy Tickets are non-refundable, non-transferable, and non-reschedulable. 9. Reservation of Rights The College reserves the rights of amendment to visitors’ guidelines without prior notice as circumstances require. 10. By registering and attending PPDS activities, visitors’ consent to the above guidelines is granted. *We are unable to accommodate walk-in visitors. Thank you for your understanding *

title: Dog shelter: New volunteer training with "Sai Kung Stray Friends"
summary: This program for animal lovers, will give you hands-on experience working as a member of our volunteer team caring for over 200 dogs.
organizer: Sai Kung Stray Friends Foundation Limited
venue: 151 Tai Lam Wu Rd, 151 Tai Lam Wu Road, Sai Kung, NT, Hong Kong, Sai Kung, NT
description: Sai Kung Stray Friends Foundation founded by Ms. Narelle Pamuk is a volunteer run charity that rescues and cares for stray dogs in Hong Kong. Our dog shelter in Sai Kung takes care of over 200 dogs. Our dedicated team of volunteers support our Kennel Manager Ms. Kathy to manage and operate the dog shelter for all 365 days of the year. The daily work routine includes walking the dogs, cleaning, cooking food, feeding the dogs, driving the dogs to the vets, deliver food & medical care to stray dogs around Sai Kung and Lok Ma Chau. Our team of volunteers come from diverse background and share a common love for dogs. This program is for animal lovers who are interested to join as a member of our team of volunteers. During the training, you will get to do the various house keeping tasks (cleaning, cooking, washing etc) to be done at shelter. Get to know the various dogs, understand differences of every dogs to take care when leashing/walking. And also get to know the dogs that new volunteers should not disturb. By the end of the day, you will have experienced the daily work routine of a regular volunteer at the shelter. You can then decide if you are able to commit to join our team and volunteer regularly every week. The training will be led by our senior volunteers. ⁠⁠Each group will consist of 6-10 people. The training will be bi-lingual in Cantonese and English. ⁠note1. Participants need to be above 16 yo of age commited to animal welfare. note2. Participants are required to sign the waiver of liability agreement note3. The organiser reserves the right to cancel the event for a specific date . In such case, you will be notified by email /whatsapp the reason for cancellation and provided a list of alternate dates that you can select based on your convenience.

title: 【DX設計館 | Everday+常物】常物在生活分享會 | INFORMAL SOLUTIONS Sharing
summary: 參加【DX設計館 | Everyday+常物】展覽分享會，探索日常物品的無限可能，聆聽ISLANDERS與蕭競聰先生的觀察與詮釋，歡迎親子家庭參與！
organizer: 香港設計中心 Hong Kong Design Centre
venue: DX design hub, DX design hub 280 Tung Chau Street, Sham Shui Po, KOW, Hong Kong, Sham Shui Po, KOW
description: 你有想過日常生活的物品還有可以用作什麼用途嗎?德國攝影師Michael Wolf曾拍攝的有關香港「Informal Solutions」（民間智慧）作品的啟發，「Everyday+常物」展覽帶你重新發現生活中物件的無限可能！ 這次創意分享會，我們邀請到ISLANDERS島民分享對深水埗社區日常物的觀察，以及透過工作坊與公眾找尋常物再創造的視覺文化地圖。同時，亦邀請了獨立策展人、設計教育學者及民間博物館計劃發起人之一的蕭競聰，分他其以「日常物件」作為設計、創意研究議題的案例，由《唔知做乜嘅設計》、《尋找無名設計師》展覽、《揦西設計》 到《「不棄的日常造形一家親Undiscarded Everyday》」大家一起探索對日常物的觀察與詮釋。歡迎親子家庭參與，一起來發掘日常中的創意火花！ 活動詳情: Ever wondered what new life old everyday ordinary objects could have? Inspired by German photographer Michael Wolf’s ‘Informal Solutions’ series, the ‘Everyday Plus’ Exhibition invites you to rediscover the endless possibilities of daily objects! In this creative sharing session, ISLANDERS will share their unique observations of everyday objects in Sham Shui Po, guiding participants through a workshop to create a visual culture map that reimagines these items. We are also to have curator, design scholar and educator Siu King-chung, who will share his extensive research journey on everyday objects, from exhibitions like ‘Designs that You Don’t Know What To Do With’, ‘In Search of Anonymous Designers’, ‘Lesser Design’, and more. Join us to explore fresh perspectives on the stories and creative interpretations of daily objects.

title: 【DX設計館 | Everyday+常物】行過路過唔好錯過導賞團 | Everyday Plus Curatorial Guided Tours
summary: 〈Everyday+常物〉的策展團隊由Talking Hands主理人徐巧詩和Milk Design的創意總監利志榮組成，展覽內容以日常物為創作主題原點，從設計師角度出發，與大眾分享、探索設計與生活的密切關係。公眾導賞團將由策展團隊主持，在每個月特定周六的下午時段駐場。
organizer: 設計深度行 Unleashing Creativity in SSP
venue: DX design hub, DX design hub 280 Tung Chau Street, Sham Shui Po, KOW, Hong Kong, Sham Shui Po, KOW
description: 〈Everyday+常物〉的策展團隊由Talking Hands主理人徐巧詩和Milk Design的創意總監利志榮組成，展覽內容以日常物為創作主題原點，從設計師角度出發，與大眾分享、探索設計與生活的密切關係。公眾導賞團將由策展團隊主持，在每個月特定周六的下午時段駐場，分享展覽背後的設計案例，聆聽大家與日常物件的生活故事。 活動詳情: What connects design and everyday life? Let’s start with the objects around us. The curatorial team of Everyday Plus is led by Ire Tsui, founder of Talking Hands, together with Chi-wing Lee, creative director of Milk Design. The exhibition showcases everyday objects from the designers’ perspectives, exploring the close connection between design and daily life for the public. The curatorial team will host public guided tours on selected… of each month.They will share the design stories behind the exhibition and engage in conversations, inviting everyone to share their own life stories related to everyday objects. Details

title: 食得醒．活得勁 | Eat Well, Live Well
summary: 從「吃得好」開始「活得好」，將希望注入生活，讓飲食成為文化實踐的一部分。
venue: 16/F, Chun Wo Commercial Centre 23-27 Wing Wo Street, Sheung Wan, HKI, Hong Kong, Sheung Wan, HKI
description: 【💪🏻🎨有肌會發達，拍定手先啦！｜NEVER SKIP GAME DAY】 藝術家用身體感受世界，運動員以身體衝破界限。無論你揮筆、奔跑，還是靜靜沉思，一個被好好照顧的身體，永遠都是你最堅實的夥伴。根據心理學家Snyder的「希望理論」（Hope Theory），健康的身體不僅是希望的結果，更是希望的來源。當我們透過飲食滋養身體時，事實上是在為自己建立更多追尋目標的動力，以及解決困難的能力。 然而，飲食作為人類的本能，卻隨年月變得曲折離奇，我們越大越發現自己「唔識食」。本應滋養我們的飲食，竟變成健康問題的來源。如果良藥必苦、糖衣帶毒，通往健康的道路是荊棘滿途，試問有誰想上路？ 依家阿彤帶個喜訊畀大家，其實藝術家唔食風都可以有啖好食！在這場結合飲食與身體意識的工作坊中，健身教練/寫作人阿日將帶領我們進行肌肉訓練，然後廚師/雜誌編輯Alan將為大家準備健康的簡餐，邀請你一起探索食物如何幫助身體達到理想狀態、如何回應創作與運動的節奏──從「吃得好」開始「活得好」，將希望注入生活，讓飲食成為文化實踐的一部分。 Artists use their bodies to feel the world, while athletes use their bodies to push boundaries. Whether painting, running, or quietly thinking, a well-cared-for body is always your strongest partner. Psychologist Snyder's "Hope Theory" suggests a healthy body is not only the result of hope but also a source of hope. When we nourish our bodies through food, we build motivation to chase goals and strengthen problem-solving ability. When it comes to health, something as intuitive as eating has become unnecessarily complicated; what nourishes us has now caused problems. How might we eat properly without compromising gastronomical pursuits? Here’s a good news from the leading artist Tung: there’s a way out! In this workshop on food and body awareness, fitness coach/writer Yat will lead us through muscle training. Subsequently, chef/editor Alan will prepare a healthy, light meal. Explore how food helps your body reach its ideal state and responds to creativity and exercise rhythms. Starting with "eat well,” we'll make food an integral part of our cultural practice as a way to “live well” with hope. _______________________ 費用全免(參加者須預繳港幣100元可退還按金) Free (participants are required to settle a refundable deposit at HKD100 to secure their registration) _______________________ 導師 Instructors 羅維日（阿日）Law Wai Yat (Yat) 健齡13年，由35吋肚腩到24/7腹肌，期望諸君食得開心操得順心，不再把白烚無鹽誤會成健康的不二法門。 With 13 years of fitness experience, gone from a 35-inch waist to having abs all day. Hope everyone enjoy eating and exercising without thinking plain boiled food is the only healthy option. 虞興華 Alan Yu 《Sample樣本》雜誌編輯，因貪食而轉行，現職廚師。相信透過理解食物與技術的本質，可以讓簡單的食物也變得美味。最愛的食物是漢堡和牛扒。 Editor of Sample magazine turned chef. With belief in simple food can be tasty with the right skills. His favourite foods are burgers and steak.

summary: ✨沉浸式體驗100%日系夏夜狂熱✨女團表演加盟演出！！️️@Edenco.hk & @Sosoc.hk 聯合舉辦！

title: [ENG] Mind HK x DOTS - a solo play by Annie Cheung 香港心聆 x 《想・點》——張雅麗獨腳戲綵排表演
summary: Annie is offering an open dress rehearsal of her solo play DOTS, to open up a conversation about mental health and resilience.
venue: 藝穗會 The Fringe Club, 2 下亞厘畢道 Jockey Club Studio, 中環, HKI, Hong Kong, 中環, HKI
description: Annie Cheung, actress and playwright of the solo performance DOTS, is offering an open dress rehearsal performance of DOTS before its formal run at the Edinburgh Fringe in August this year. As a form of self-exploration and revelation, this performance creates a space for conversations about mental health and resilience. Amy Hung, expressive arts therapist and drama educator, will join Annie in the post-show sharing session to discuss the concepts and messages behind the performance. As a Mental Health Ambassador at Mind HK, Annie shares her mental health recovery journey with the community. Join us in watching her performance, and let’s talk about mental health to normalise and destigmatise it! 《想・點》是由張雅麗（Annie Cheung）創作和演出的獨腳戲。這次，Annie 將會在八月 Edinburgh Fringe 正式表演前，開放公開綵排給我們欣賞。 作爲自己探索和揭示的媒介，這場表演將締造一個談論精神健康和復元和空間。表達藝術治療師和戲劇教育者 Amy Hung 亦會在表演後，與 Annie 一起分享戲劇表演背後的概念和訊息。 作爲心聆大使，Annie 亦與觀眾分享她的精神健康復元旅程。與我們一起觀賞她的表演，參與我們爲精神健康去污名化的努力吧！ Event details 活動詳情 Date 日期: 24 July 2025 (Thursday) 2025年7月24日（星期四） Time 時間: 7:30PM – 9:00PM (7:30PM-7:45PM Registration 入場, 7:45PM – 8:30PM Annie’s performance 獨腳戲表演, 8:30PM – 9:00PM Post-show sharing with Annie and Amy Hung 分享環節) Venue 地點: The Jockey Club Studio Theatre, Fringe Club 藝穗會賽馬會劇場 Format 模式: Open dress rehearsal and post-show sharing 公開綵排及分享環節 Performer 表演者: Annie Cheung 張雅麗 Guests 嘉賓: Amy Hung 洪美芝 Language 語言: Performance in English, bilingual post-show sharing 英語演出，雙語分享環節 Ticket 費用: Free of charge 免費 *This performance is suitable for audiences aged 14 and above *此表演適合 14 歲或以上人士觀賞 *Content warning: this performance discusses themes such as suicide, sex and depression with occasional use of foul language, and may be upsetting for some people. *內容警告：此表演內容討論自殺、性、抑鬱等議題，並包含粗俗語言，可能對觀眾造成不安，敬請留意。 About DOTS 關於《想點》 About DOTS “Only the fearless embrace their weakness— and call it strength.” DOTS, a solo play written and performed by Annie was staged in London twice with 5-star reviews. Since then, the show has gone places, in person or offline, before and during COVID-19: New York, Singapore, Vancouver, and Hong Kong. Nominated for IATCHK Performer of the Year and HK Theatre Libre Outstanding Lead Actress, Annie masterfully blends tragedy and comedy in DOTS, a critically acclaimed solo performance that lays bare the struggles of a high-achieving, yet insecure mind. Rooted in self-revelatory performance—a genre pioneered by renowned drama therapy scholar Professor Renée Emunah, DOTS is a unique solo performance merging therapy and theatre. 「真正無懼，就能擁抱脆弱， 甚至將弱點變為力量。」 Annie於倫敦期間，兩度上演自編丶自導丶自演的首個英語獨腳戲DOTS，大獲五星好評。此劇後來於COVID期間獲邀參與紐約及新加坡的線上戲劇節，並於2022年於溫哥華及香港演出英語與粵語版本。2023年Annie憑《想·點》（DOTS廣東話版）獲提名IATC(HK)劇評人奬年度演員獎及香港小劇場奬最佳女主角。這是一個不停遊走於悲劇與喜劇之間的女生獨腳戲，Annie勇敢丶赤裸丶幽默地向觀眾呈現她的高成就但極不安的情感世界。 《想 · 點》是一個自我揭示演出，由著名美國戲劇治療學者與先鋒Professor Renée Emunah所建立，是一個結合治療與劇場的獨特劇種。 About Annie Cheung 關於張雅麗 Annie is an actress, a singer-songwriter and a playwright. Currently an Associate Professor of Practice at the Academy of Film, Hong Kong Baptist University. Nominated for Hong Kong Drama Awards Best Musical Lead Actress and Best Supporting Actress (Tragedy/Drama), IATCHK Performer of the Year, and twice nominated for HK Theatre Libre Outstanding Lead Actress. Graduated with an MA (distinction) and a full scholarship from Mountview Academy of Theatre Arts. Recently in June, she performed a concert version of her solo cabaret LI(N)ES 2.0 at West Kowloon Cabaret Nights with great success. She adapted a Spanish classic play YERMA into a radical, modern Cantonese version named 《妻迷》 which has just been staged in Hong Kong with extremely rave reviews. 香港女演員/唱作歌手/編劇，現任香港浸會大學電影學院專業應用副教授。 畢業後不久憑《聖訴》（Doubt: A Parable）母親一角﹙Mrs. Muller﹚獲提名第二十二屆香港舞台劇獎最佳女配角﹙悲劇／正劇﹚。2017年獲獎學金於倫敦著名戲劇學府Mountview Academy of Theatre Arts修讀表演碩士課程，並以優異成績畢業。2023年憑《想·點》（DOTS廣東話版）獲提名IATC(HK)劇評人奬年度演員獎及香港小劇場奬最佳女主角。2024年於香港上演第二部原創獨腳戲《跣》LI(N)ES，以歌廳（Cabaret）形式演出其一手包辦的十三首原創曲詞，分享人生路上「跣親」及重生的經歷，並憑此劇獲提名第三十三屆香港舞台劇獎最佳音樂劇女主角及香港小劇場奬最佳女主角。 今年六月聯同著名音樂家朱肇階及樂隊成員，獲邀參與「西九夜延場」，於西九戲曲中心茶館劇場上演《跣》 2.0 （音樂會版），演出再次獲得高度評價。剛上演的《妻迷》，是Annie最新的編劇作品，改編自西班牙著名劇作家羅卡的經典劇作YERMA，好評如潮。 What the audience said 觀眾回饋 'This dark, autobiographical piece of theatre is brutally honest, extremely relatable and full of humour' **** (NorthWestEnd.co.uk). 'Beautiful, raw and real. Taps into universal human feelings and experiences whilst being courageously personal' ***** (StageDoorApp.com). ‘What a beautiful performance! Congratulations Annie !! It’s very touching and I really appreciate her hard work and bravery ,opening up her deep pain and emotion to the audience . I can see the power of story telling， praising the strength of honesty as an artist ! I am so happy to see this lovely woman grounded now, transforming and shining as a good actress on stage ! Hope more people can watch the show and hopefully it will have rerun in the future!’ - 甄詠蓓 真摯、坦率、誠懇、勇敢—— 我覺得是每一位從事藝術工作的人必備之條件。我不知道這個世界上總共有多少人看過「DOTS 想。點」，我興幸我是其中之一。這獨腳戲是一場精彩的表演，但我認為更是一趟慘痛的刮骨療傷。「希望這個戲有一條好命！」- 蘇玉華 About Amy Hung 關於洪美芝 Dedicated to working with children, adolescents, and juvenile offenders, Amy completed the Alternative Training Program by the North American Drama Therapy Association. She holds a Master’s degree in Expressive Arts Therapy from the University of Hong Kong and a Master’s degree in Counseling from Hong Kong Baptist University, along with Associate Teaching Diplomas (Distinction) in Speech and Drama from Trinity College London. Amy completed her Self-Revelatory Performance in March 2025. Primarily focused on providing drama therapy and expressive arts services to NGOs and schools, Amy also offers training and supervision for professionals in the field. In addition to her clinical work, she serves as a drama critic and drama educator, specializing in teaching creative drama. IG @theyouthflow Amy致力於與兒童、青少年及青少年罪犯工作，完成了北美戲劇治療協會的替代課程。她擁有香港大學的表達藝術治療碩士學位、香港浸會大學的輔導碩士學位及倫敦聖三一學院的語言及戲劇教學文憑（優異）。Amy於2025年3月完成了她的自我剖白演出。她近年主要為非政府組織和學校提供戲劇治療和表達藝術治療服務，同時也為社工提供培訓和指導。除了臨床工作外，她還擔任戲劇評論及戲劇教育工作，專門教授創意戲劇。 IG @theyouthflow About More Than a Label 關於「我就是我」 “More Than a Label” is Mind HK’s anti-stigma campaign, in partnership with and sponsored by MINDSET Hong Kong, and sponsored by Manulife, which stems from its goal of changing and influencing the public’s perception towards persons with diagnosable mental health conditions. This campaign encourages the public to look beyond the typical, stigmatising, labels associated with mental health diagnoses. Through personal stories of mental health journeys, we want to showcase realistic portrayals of people who have faced mental health problems and recovered and depict their holistic identity. With this campaign, we hope to raise awareness of the stigma towards persons with mental health conditions, celebrate the resilience and strength of people in recovery, and educate and equip the public with mental health knowledge. We believe this will facilitate more conversation in mental health, which will in turn help destigmatise mental health in Hong Kong. 「我就是我More Than a Label」是由香港心聆策劃的計劃，並得到思健作爲夥伴與贊助商，以及宏利的贊助。計劃源於我們希望改變大眾對精神疾病患者的觀感。此計劃透過邀請復元人士分享他們的精神健康復元故事，來展示他們最真實的一面、描繪最真實的自己，藉此鼓勵大眾擺脫對精神疾病的固有觀念、污名及標籤。 我們希望透過這個計劃來提升大眾對精神疾病及其污名的認知，並為復元人士充權。我們深信這次計劃能鼓勵社會大眾展開更多有關精神健康的對話，協助消除有關精神健康的污名。

title: Family Day - Earth Art For Children
summary: Earth sculpture, painting with natural pigments, imprints, incorporating foraged natural objects.
venue: Ark Eden, 11 Tung Hang Mei Mui Wo, Lantau Island, NT, Hong Kong, Lantau Island, NT
description: Dates: October 29th – November 30th Join us for a transformative experience this fall at the Natural Building Workshops, a unique collaboration between Alex from Bisque-kit, Ania from Ania Natural Materials, and Jenny from Ark Eden. This hands-on series is designed to introduce participants to sustainable building techniques, reconnect them with nature, and nurture creativity in the process. Our expert instructors bring a wealth of knowledge and diverse experience from around the globe: Together, these three professionals bring expertise in architectural design, hands-on natural building, and environmental sustainability to create an unforgettable learning experience.Family Day: Earth Art For Children (October 29th) Family Day: A Fun Introduction to Earth Building We’re kicking off the series with a family-friendly day that’s all about play, creativity, and getting in touch with nature. This relaxed and interactive workshop is ideal for children and families to explore natural building materials, create art, and try out basic building techniques in a fun, creative environment. The day will include earth sculptures, painting with natural pigments, imprinting and incorporating foraged items! natural objects. Terms and Conditions: Workshop Safety & Participation Disclaimer All participants in the Earth Building Workshop Series do so at their own risk. While the activities are designed to be low-risk and suitable for beginners, they involve natural building materials such as clay, sand, straw, bamboo, and tools like trowels or shovels. By attending, participants acknowledge that: -They will follow the instructions of the workshop leaders at all times -They understand the nature of the physical activities involved, including manual mixing, lifting, and sculpting with earth materials -Children under 16 must be supervised by a parent or designated responsible adult The organizers will provide basic protective items (e.g. gloves), hydration stations, and shaded areas, but recommend that participants bring appropriate clothing, footwear, and sun protection. The workshop area will be kept clean and hazard-free to the best of our ability, and the team reserves the right to stop or adjust any activity for safety reasons.

summary: Gajen Nad is a Malaysian stand-up comedian, emcee, and motivational speaker. Gajen is known for his clean & intellectual humor.
venue: BaseHall 2, 1 Connaught Place #15 LG/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: In 2012, Gajen Nad took his first steps into stand-up comedy and event emceeing. After 6 years of balancing his passion with a corporate career, he made a bold move in 2018 to pursue comedy full-time. His dedication paid off when, last year, his comedy special, Professional Mixed Breed, premiered globally on Netflix, marking a major milestone as the first Penang-born comedian to achieve this. With over a decade of experience and over 1,000 events under his belt, he is known for his corporate-friendly and intelligent comedy suited for everyone! Here's what Gajen has to say about this show: "Listen, I mean read, here is my brand new 1-hour comedy special, Global Malaysian Chindian." This is a sequel to my previous special, Professional Mixed Breed, in 2022 (it's on Netflix!). In this show, I go deep into my roots and beginnings. From my Chindian childhood in the 90s, strict Indian family career expectations, engineering life, my Germany adventures, and...my niche toilet preferences. As always, the jokes are clean, culturally relatable, and perfect for locals and international friends alike! Bring your friends, dates, parents...even your ex. I promise it won’t be weird. See you soon!" This show is in English

title: Good Grief
summary: A peer support group to openly discuss shared experiences of grief by The New Normal. All are welcome.
organizer: The New Normal Charity Hong Kong
venue: The Hive Wan Chai, 23 Luard Road 9/F, Wan Chai, HKI, Hong Kong, Wan Chai, HKI
description: What it is Good Grief is a free peer support group for anyone who has experienced/to talk about grief and bereavement. Our peer support groups are free to join. Good Grief provides a supportive, judgment-free space where people can share their experiences of loss, connect with others who understand, and find comfort as a collective. Led by trained hosts, our sessions offer a supportive environment to navigate grief together. What happens A peer support group is where people come together to share personal stories, listen and support one another with kindness. You will be welcomed by two hosts who are trained TNN volunteers with lived experience in the topic of the group. It is normal to feel nervous, and sharing can be a big decision. Remember you are deserving of care and support. You are welcome to join us and just listen. Our hosts will welcome you and provide an introduction, then we will ask you to introduce yourself and your reason for joining us. From then on there is no pressure to speak. Our hosts will facilitate conversation. A peer support group is a supportive space where people can: Share stories and how our experiences are currently impacting our lives Talk about our feelings and emotions Share and discuss coping strategies Group guidelines We have some basic guidance that we ask everyone to adhere to, to ensure this remains an inclusive space for everyone: Please note As a peer support group, this group is for peers to share their personal struggles and support one another. Attendees are welcome to come and listen but it is not a space to observe. You should attend to engage in peer support. It is not a space for students to contribute to their studies, for clinicians to observe, or for the press unless written agreement from the charity has been obtained. Who are The New Normal Charity? We are a Hong Kong S88 registered charity. The New Normal Hong Kong have been hosting our free peer support groups in Hong Kong since 2022. Our groups are facilitated by volunteers. While our hosts are trained to facilitate, we are not mental health professionals in this space. We do not give advice, we provide space for all of you to share, connect and support. Nobody should ever feel alone, and there is always somebody who can relate to your story. www.thenewnormalcharityhk.org If you are in crisis and don’t feel like you can keep yourself safe there are immediate services available. 危機求助熱線如果你覺得你不能保證自己的安全 Samaritans 2341 7227 (until 10pm) 2389 2222 (24/7) Caritas 18288 SPS Hotline 23820000 Address The Hive Wan Chai 9/F, The Phoenix, 23 Luard Rd, Wan Chai, Hong Kong How to get there 3 minute walk from Wan Chai Station: From Exit C, turn left and walk along Lockhart Road. Turn right when you reach Luard Road. Walk up Luard Road – The Phoenix will be on your left.

title: GuWei Museum visit with afternoon tea set
summary: Join us for a 1.5-hour guided tour of GuWei Museum, featuring the "Wanli Shipwreck" exhibition and afternoon tea with stunning views!
venue: GuWei Museum, 21 Wong Chuk Hang Road #33/F, Wong Chuk Hang, HKI, Hong Kong, Wong Chuk Hang, HKI
description: In this special visit, we will explore the GuWei Museum with an expert guided tour lasting 1.5 hours. We will conclude with afternoon tea, enjoying stunning panoramic views of Aberdeen Lower Reservoir and Lamma Island at the Museum Coffee Shop. The GuWei Museum is committed to passing on both Chinese and foreign traditional cultures to the next generation by organizing exhibitions and cultural and educational activities. During this visit, you will have the opportunity to view the new exhibition, “The Wanli Shipwreck: Blue-and-White Porcelain in Global Trade.” Our guide will share insights about their collection and the stories behind it. Date and Time: July 19 (Sat) 2:30-4pm (Guided Tour), Afternoon tea after tour Fee: $160/person. Fee includes guided 1.5-hour guided tour, along with an afternoon tea set that features coffee or tea and a cake. About Guwei Museum www.guweimuseum.comCo-founded by Mr. Franco Cutrupia, Chairman of the Sapientia Foundation, and his wife, Ms. Pauline Ngai Cutrupia, the GuWei Museum is the first private museum in the Southern District to blend exhibitions, cultural education, and leisure. Opened to the public on 24 September 2024, the museum features a diverse collection of 1,035 artefacts from various historical periods and regions worldwide. These include porcelainware, silverware, carpets, paintings, textiles, and jewellery, inviting visitors to explore the distinctive patterns, forms, and colours that represent both Eastern and Western cultures. In addition to its exhibitions, the museum offers a vibrant array of workshops and programmes for all ages, inspiring creativity and bringing fresh dynamism to Hong Kong's cultural landscape.

description: $320｜ Early Bird: $280 | 👫 Group of 4: $1,000 | Join after 10pm $200 Gypsy Swing Sensations 感受吉普賽搖擺 Experience the vibrant energy of 1930s Paris with the Hot Club de HK at the Allure Music Salon located in Century Stone House. Photo & Video: @foofoto_p (符敬偉 Foo King Wai ) Immerse yourself in the captivating rhythms of Gypsy swing as guitars, violins, and a double bass weave an enchanting musical tapestry. Complemented by mesmerizing vocals, join us for an exhilarating evening filled with timeless melodies and step into the magic of a bygone era. 體驗1930年代巴黎的活力，在世紀石屋的Allure音樂沙龍內，與及爵士樂隊Hot Club de HK度過美妙的夜晚。沉浸在吉普賽搖擺音樂的迷人節奏中，吉他、小提琴和低音大提琴交織出一幅迷人的音樂畫卷。搭配迷人的歌聲，一起享受充滿永恆旋律的振奮夜晚，重返那消逝已久的魔幻時代。 Featuring Guitar:Simon Choi Guitar:Neil Lau Violin: Bob Pang Double Bass: Vera Cura Vocals: Adrianna Tang ✨ Tai Hang’s Allure Pass 2025 Discover the charm of Tai Hang, where hair, music, and cuisine blend seamlessly into a unique urban escape. 💇‍♀️🎶🍴 From chic styling to live melodies and culinary delights, this chill community invites you to explore, indulge, and unwind. 🌟 Your Allure Pass opens doors to exclusive perks—just show it and enjoy. ✨ 大坑 Allure Pass 2025 探索大坑的獨特魅力，感受髮型設計、音樂與美食的完美交融。💇‍♀️🎶🍴 從時尚造型到動人旋律，再到美味佳餚，邀您放鬆身心，盡情享受。🌟 憑Allure Pass尊享專屬禮遇! Explore the Artistry of Musicians Hot Club de Hong Kong Hot Club de HK focuses on vintage 30’s - 40’s France's gypsy jazz. Inspired by Django Reinhardt - the father of gypsy jazz, the band adopts his arrangement styles, playing techniques to interpret various genres of music. From European traditional to American songbooks; swing to bossa nova; film music to pop… Hot Club de HK devotes to build gypsy jazz community in Hong Kong, and present the beauty of gypsy jazz music. The only active Gypsy Jazz band in town! Formed by Simon Choi, Neil Lau (Guitarist); Sing Pun (Guitarist); Bob Pang (Violinist) and Vera Cura(Double Bassist). Hot Club de HK focuses on vintage 30’s - 40’s France's gypsy jazz. Inspired by Django Reinhardt - the father of gypsy jazz, the band adopts his arrangement styles, playing techniques to interpret various genres of music. From European traditional to American songbooks; swing to bossa nova; film music to pop… Hot Club de HK devotes to build gypsy jazz community in Hong Kong, and present the beauty of gypsy jazz music. Hot Club de Hong Kong可能是香港唯一活躍的法式吉卜賽爵士(Gypsy Jazz/Jazz Manouche)樂隊，為你呈獻上世紀三四十年代嘅巴黎韻味。 Hot Club de Hong Kong由本地樂隊Cowhead與Blaster兩位結他手Simon Choi與Neil Lau，兩個畢業於香港教育大學音樂系嘅小提琴手Bob Pang 、結他手Sing Pun和低音大提琴手Vera組成。成員們彈奏各音樂類型多年，機緣巧合下認識到嚟自法國嘅吉卜賽爵士樂，被深深吸引，於是組成Hot Club de Hong Kong。 樂隊演奏風格啟發自吉卜賽爵士奠基者Django Reinhardt及Stéphane Grappelli，以三十年代巴黎風格為基調，糅合美式爵士、拉丁節奏，以原聲結他同小提琴演奏一系列吉卜賽爵士及爵士標準曲。 現時世界各地皆有Hot Club，向Hot Club de France的Django Reinhardt致敬。Hot Club de Hong Kong致力在香港普及吉卜賽爵士樂、建立爵士樂社群、為本土音樂注入新元素。 Allure Music Salon: Evenings of Music and Mastery Allure Music Salon, nestled in Tai Hang's historic Century Stone House, Hong Kong, hosts enthralling musical evenings and workshops. Our Incubating series and Masters events spotlight emerging talents and seasoned maestros, fostering connections and inspiring audiences. Join us for a transformative experience where creativity shapes the future of music. Allure Music Salon 位於香港大坑歷史悠久的世紀石屋，舉辦迷人的音樂之夜和工作坊。我們的孵化系列和大師活動突顯新興才能與資深大師，促進互動並啟發觀眾。加入我們，體驗在創意塑造音樂未來的轉變性體驗。 Allure Friends Privacy Policy Allure Music Salon is committed to protecting your privacy and complies with the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance. This policy outlines our practices regarding the collection, use, sharing, and protection of personal data. Types of Personal Data Collected: name, email and phone number Purpose: Identity verification, Security and Activity updates Personal data is treated confidentially. We will use a third-party email system to send you emails. Personal data is retained only as long as necessary for the purpose for which it was collected and is protected using adequate security measures to prevent unauthorized access or loss. Access to and Correction of Personal Data You have the right to access and correct your personal data held by Allure Music Salon. Requests can be made to Allure Music Salon via email at alluremusicsalon@gmail.com or through other provided contact methods. 承諾保護隱私 Allure Music Salon 致力於保護您的隱私，並遵守《個人資料（私隱）條例》。本政策概述了我們關於收集、使用、分享及保護個人資料的做法。 收集的個人資料類型: 姓名、電郵及電話號碼 收集目的：身份驗證、保安及通知最新活動 資料會保密處理。我們會使用第三方電郵系統向您發送電郵。 個人資料僅在收集目的所需的時間內保留，並採用適當的安全措施防止未經授權的存取或丟失。 存取及更正個人資料 您有權存取和更正Allure Music Salon 持有的您的個人資料。可以通過電郵至 alluremusicsalon@gmail.com 或其他提供的聯繫方式，提出請求。 Allure Incubating Fridays is exclusive event series (Music Appreciation Workshop) presented by Allure Music Salon. Allure Incubating Fridays 是由 Allure Music Salon 提供獨家活動系列 (音樂鑑賞工作坊)。

title: Happy Hours with Plants 與植物的快樂時光
summary: 週末一齊涼冷氣 + DIY 無土棉小盆栽 + 識新 Friends (對象年齡 - 30 - 50 歲) 語言：廣東話
description: 🌸 [ 簡介 ] 🌸 植物能讓繁忙的城市人放鬆心情，並能淨化空氣、促進我們的身心靈健康。 這工作坊透過創作迷你無土盆栽及小遊戲，拉近人和大自然的距離，並增進參加者之間的認識。 😎 內容: (1) DIY 無土棉Mini盆栽 (2) Mini Games (3) 互相認識環節 😎 名額：上限12 人 (* 對象年齡 - 30 - 50 歲*) 😎 語言：廣東話 😎 活動主持：Ms. Claire Leung 😎 費用：$268 (每人做 2 款無土小盆栽帶回家; 送簡單零食/飲品) 🏠 地點：尖沙咀柯士甸路8號 Somptueux Austin 8樓 D室 （⚠️請注意: 柯士甸路不是柯士甸道／近香港歷史博物館對面） 🏖️ 我們相信：親近自然 讓生命更美 🏖️ ​"One Touch of Nature makes the whole world kin." ~ William Shakespeare [ 主持人簡介 About our Facilitator ] ​活動主持人 Ms. Claire Leung 喜愛大自然、園藝及手作，曾於本地永續農場及生態保育機構從事環境教育工作，及後任教於香港專業教育學院，並為香港公開大學(現香港都會大學)李嘉誠專業進修學院(LiPACE) 撰寫本港自然生態教材。 工作坊設計以實用及簡單易學為主，輕鬆、有趣，願每位學員都能夠寓學於樂。

title: Healing Hearts
summary: A peer support group for anyone in any stage of a breakup by The New Normal. All are welcome.
organizer: The New Normal Charity Hong Kong
venue: The Hive Wan Chai, 23 Luard Road 9/F, Wan Chai, HKI, Hong Kong, Wan Chai, HKI
description: What it is Healing Hearts is a peer support group for anyone navigating the challenges of a breakup, divorce, or separation. Our support space offers connection, understanding, and shared experiences to help process emotions and share strategies to cope. What happens A peer support group is where people come together to share personal stories, listen and support one another with kindness. You will be welcomed by two hosts who are trained TNN volunteers with lived experience on the topic of the group. It is normal to feel nervous, and sharing can be a big decision. Remember you are deserving of care and support. You are welcome to join us and just listen. Our hosts will welcome you and provide an introduction, then we will ask you to introduce yourself and your reason for joining us. From then on there is no pressure to speak. Our hosts will facilitate the conversation. A peer support group is a supportive space where people can: Share stories and how our experiences are currently impacting our lives Talk about our feelings and emotions Share and discuss coping strategies Group guidelines We have some basic guidelines that we ask everyone to adhere to, to ensure this remains an inclusive space for everyone: Please note As a peer support group, this group is for peers to share their personal struggles and support one another. Attendees are welcome to come and listen but it is not a space to observe. You should attend to engage in peer support. It is not a space for students to contribute to their studies, for clinicians to observe, or for the press unless written agreement from the charity has been obtained. Who are The New Normal Charity? We are a Hong Kong S88 registered charity. The New Normal Hong Kong has been hosting our free peer support groups in Hong Kong since 2022. Our groups are facilitated by volunteers. While our hosts are trained to facilitate, we are not mental health professionals in this space. We do not give advice, we provide space for all of you to share, connect and support. Nobody should ever feel alone, and there is always somebody who can relate to your story. If you are in crisis and don’t feel like you can keep yourself safe, there are immediate services available. www.thenewnormalcharityhk.org 危機求助熱線如果你覺得你不能保證自己的安全 Samaritans 2341 7227 (until 10pm) 2389 2222 (24/7) Caritas 18288 SPS Hotline 23820000 Address The Hive Wan Chai 9/F, The Phoenix, 23 Luard Rd, Wan Chai, Hong Kong How to get there 3 minute walk from Wan Chai Station: From Exit C, turn left and walk along Lockhart Road. Turn right when you reach Luard Road. Walk up Luard Road – The Phoenix will be on your left.

title: IFINEXPO HK - Connecting the Financial Ecosystem
summary: Connect the financial industry chain and provide information resources and solutions for the financial industry.
venue: 3/F, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre, 1號 博覽道, Wan Chai District, HKI, Hong Kong, Wan Chai District, HKI
description: The grand event opens, and the financial blueprint is drawn together In this rapidly changing financial era, IFINEXPO Hong Kong International Financial Expo, as a brilliant event in the financial community of Asia and even the world, is about to open brilliantly! We sincerely invite global financial elites, innovative enterprises, investment institutions and industry pioneers to gather in the Pearl of the Orient - Hong Kong, and work together to build an unprecedented knowledge sharing and resource docking platform, so that every drop of financial water can be accurately irrigated, and the industry can move towards a more efficient and intelligent future. Exhibition area: Kaleidoscope of financial innovation Stepping into the exhibition area is like stepping into a dream world of financial technology. From the latest application of blockchain technology to the precise practice of artificial intelligence in financial risk control, from the sustainable development plan of green finance to the cutting-edge exploration of digital currency, hundreds of exhibitors will showcase their latest achievements and solutions here. This is not only a feast of vision and technology, but also the best example of the integration of financial innovation and tradition, so that every visitor can feel the strong beating of the financial pulse. Conference Forum: The collision of wisdom, the spark of thought The conference forum area is a stage for the confrontation of ideas and the collision of wisdom. We have carefully planned a series of high-end dialogues, keynote speeches and roundtable forums, inviting well-known scholars, financial industry experts and corporate leaders from home and abroad to discuss the latest trends in financial technology, regulatory policies, market opportunities and challenges and other hot topics around the theme of "building a platform for knowledge sharing and resource docking to make finance more efficient". Here, every exchange may inspire new inspiration, and every handshake may lead to the spark of cooperation. Resource docking: building a bridge for cooperation IFINEXPO is not only a platform for display and learning, but also a bridge to promote efficient resource docking. We have specially set up a business docking area to provide exhibitors, investors, entrepreneurs, financial institutions, agents, traders, etc. with one-on-one communication opportunities to help project incubation, capital introduction, technical cooperation, market expansion and investment learning. Here, every idea may find its mentor, and every effort will get due rewards. Go hand in hand and create brilliance together IFINEXPO Hong Kong International Financial Expo is a grand event in the financial industry and a preview of the future financial ecology. In this era full of opportunities and challenges, let us work together to build a more efficient, inclusive and sustainable financial future with an open mind, innovative thinking and pragmatic actions. We look forward to meeting you at IFINEXPO and opening a new chapter in finance together! Contact us: twinkle@ifinexpo.com guopei@ifinexpo.com WhatsApp：+86 18621737740

title: Introduction to Improv Course (101) - Fall Term
summary: Discover and learn the foundations to creating improvised performance in this 8-week course!
venue: Fringe Club, 2 Lower Albert Road Underground Theatre, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Overview Watched improv comedy and thought "I'd like to give that a try"? An actor looking to train up on ever popular improv skills? Needing help with public speaking skills? Just wanting to be comfortable not knowing what'll happen next? Whoever you are, whatever your background, if you're wanting to learn the skills of improv from the start and to be left with a solid grounding in improv, then this is the course for you. Over 8-weeks, discover - through the supportive, collaborative process we call improv performance - how to create stories, characters and ideas to captivate an audience right before their eyes. Develop those public speaking skills to allow easier and more natural dialogs with your audience. Learn how to relish the opportunity to embrace the unexpected! Topics covered by this workshop Dates and Times: Monday evenings, 7:00pm-9:30pmSep 8, 15, 22, 29Oct 13, 20, 27Nov 3(Note: No class Oct 6)Course Fee:Earlybird*: $1,900 ($237.5/class, $95/hr)Regular: $3,000 ($375/class, $150/hr)*Earlybird pricing ends 18th August Our TBC Course Structure Explained:Our courses and classes have 2 defining numbers. The first number defines the level.100 series - Introductory200 series - Intermediate300 series - Advancedetc.Then the 01, 02, 03 etc. defines the type of class.101 Intro to Improv (building blocks) |102 Intro to Shortform |103 Intro to Longform What have our 101 students said about the series? " A part of me didn't want the 101 to finish. It was such great experience and it really helped me to explore the different area of my brain." " Thanks for the 101 it was so muchlies fun." " Really so grateful that I hopped into 101 - the learning has been great and this has been some much needed joy, silliness and connection with new pals." ----- Logistics: Please arrive 5-10 minutes early - we will start on time. Wear comfortable clothes and shoes as we will stand and be active. Ages 16+. All are welcome, no previous improv experience required. Bring your own water bottle, there is no water available at the premises. Come ready to learn and hone your craft!

title: Introduction to Shortform Improv Course (102) - Fall Term
summary: Discover and learn the foundations of shortform improv (all the fun games!) in this 8-week course!
venue: Fringe Club, 2 Lower Albert Road Underground Theatre, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Overview Ever since the explosion of TV show "Who's Line is it Anyway?", the short-form style of improv (consisting of short scenes combining audience suggestions, improviser talents and pre-selected rules) has become synonymous with improv comedy. Though by no means the only style of improv, it is one that TBC Improv specialises in and this course will teach you the techniques behind it. Each class in the 8-week course will explore a particular genre of game: what games fall into the category, what skills they use and techniques for performing scenes within them. Become familiar with new games and reacquainted with old favourites! This course is ideally aimed at: those with some basic improv training and wishing to expand further; those who wish to specialise in short-form improv; performers with long-form background/experience wishing to become more relaxed and familiar with short-form improv. title: IT for Scrum Masters
summary: One-day workshop for Scrum Masters with no technical background to boost IT confidence, bridge tech gaps, and engage in technical
venue: Playground Coworking, 244-248 Des Voeux Road Central #11/F, Sheung Wan, HKI, Hong Kong, Sheung Wan, HKI
description: What happens when technical conversations go over your head? When decisions are made based on jargon you don’t fully understand? Or when you want to uncover what’s slowing down delivery without always needing a developer to translate? The age-old debate: should a Scrum Master be technical? It’s a hot topic, one that sparks discussions, debates, confusion, curiosity, and even controversy. But the answer is actually quite simple: it doesn’t really matter. There are highly successful technical Scrum Masters, and there are non-technical ones who fail miserably, and vice versa. It depends on many factors. But one thing is certain: having technical knowledge in your Scrum backpack is never a bad thing. This one-day workshop won’t turn you into a full-fledged Developer, that would be absurd to promise. What it will do is give you a solid foundation in IT and software engineering without writing a single line of code. Facilitated by seasoned technical trainers who’ve worked in the trenches, supported by the collective knowledge of the group, and yes, let’s be real, some help from AI, we’ll explore key technical concepts and dive into modern development workflows. Whether you’re dealing with legacy systems, cloud-native platforms, or anything in between, this day will equip you to ask better questions, spot risks earlier, engage more confidently in technical discussions, and foster stronger collaboration with your Developers, technical stakeholders, and teams while staying true to the Scrum Master accountabilities.

title: Laughs for Change - Open Mic Night
summary: Share their observations on social issues, relationships, and cultural nuances through the lens of comedy!
venue: The Aftermath, 57-59 Wyndham Street #Lower G/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: You are invited to Laughs for Change, an open mic night dedicated to using humor as a powerful tool for social commentary! This is a space where speakers, storytellers and comedians can share their observations on social issues, the environment, relationships, mental health, cultural nuances and just about anything related to the human experience through the lens of comedy. This event is in collaboration with Nerd Nite Hong Kong, a lecture event that aims at a casual, relaxed, and let’s be honest, slightly inebriated evening of academic fun times. If you have a great time with our evening of laughter, you might find yourself invited to share your thoughts at Nerd Nite! title: Music in Architecture
summary: Join RIBA Hong Kong Chapter and BeTrue for a musical tour of architecture!
venue: The Education University of Hong Kong (EdUHK), 10號 Lo Ping Road, New Territories, NT, Hong Kong, New Territories, NT
description: Exploring the Harmony of Sound and Space: A Journey Through Music and Architecture Step into a unique exploration of how sound and space intertwine in this immersive event hosted at the Education University. We begin with the background stories of the tour project, offering insight into its inspiration and purpose. Tune your senses in “Architecture in Music: Sharp Ears and Keen Eyes (耳聪目明)”, a session that reveals the hidden beauty and shared language between musical instruments and architectural forms. Experience the physical space through a guided site tour of the Education University, by Thomas Cheung, Director of CKAL, followed by an engaging conversation with BeTrue’s Kenneth Yun and Vittorio Yun. They will share insights and case studies from their “Intimate Sound & Spatial (声音和空间的亲密无间道)” soundscape project, exploring how sound can shape our perception of space and memory. The event concludes with an open Q&A session, inviting reflection and dialogue on the intersections of sound, design, and cultural storytelling. 🕒 Duration: Approximately 2 hours📍 Location: Education University🎤 Special Guests: Thomas Cheung, CKAL, Kenneth Yun & Vittorio Yun, BeTrue Co-organisers

title: Natural Building Workshops: Earth Sgraffito (2-Day Workshop)
summary: "Sgraffito" comes from the Italian word "sgraffiare," - "to scratch," where a surface is decorated by revealing contrasting colours beneath
venue: Ark Eden, 11 Tung Hang Mei Mui Wo, Lantau Island, NT, Hong Kong, Lantau Island, NT
description: Join us for a transformative experience this fall at the Natural Building Workshops, a unique collaboration between Alex from Bisque-kit, Ania from Ania Natural Materials, and Jenny from Ark Eden. This hands-on series is designed to introduce participants to sustainable building techniques, reconnect them with nature, and nurture creativity in the process. Our expert instructors bring a wealth of knowledge and diverse experience from around the globe: Together, these three professionals bring expertise in architectural design, hands-on natural building, and environmental sustainability to create an unforgettable learning experience. Discover the fascinating world of sgraffito, an ancient decorative technique used in clay plastering to create intricate, textured designs by scratching through a layer of material to reveal contrasting colors beneath. This method, originating from Italy, has been used for centuries in architecture and art, offering a unique way to add depth and detail to surfaces. In this 2-day workshop, you'll learn both the history and the hands-on practice of sgraffito. Day 1: We begin with an introduction to the history and theory behind sgraffito, exploring its cultural significance and uses throughout time. Then, you'll dive into the practice by collaborating on a large wall design, learning the technique together as you scratch through layers of clay and pigment. Day 2: On the second day, you'll have the opportunity to design and execute your own personalized sgraffito artwork. We will guide you through the process of creating custom colors from mineral pigments and clay, as well as incorporating natural elements like crushed shells and glass for added texture and vibrancy. By the end of the workshop, you’ll leave with your own unique sgraffito piece, a deeper understanding of this ancient technique, and the skills to incorporate it into future creative projects. In between your morning and afternoon workshops, participants will enjoy a freshly made vegetarian buffet lunch and light refreshments are available through out the day. Participants will receive a comprehensive information package upon ticket purchase, which will include details on how to get to the site, what to wear, and other essential information. Special Discounts:We offer discounted prices for students with a valid student ID. Whether you're passionate about sustainable living, keen to try new creative skills, or simply curious about building with natural materials, this series of workshops will empower you to make a meaningful connection to the earth and learn new skills that can last a lifetime. NOTE: A one day ticket is available for students. This is only available for saturday's session. For any questions please email: hibisquekit@gmail.com or visit our instagram page @bisque.kit Terms and Conditions: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ We’re kicking off the series with a family-friendly day on 29th October that’s all about play, creativity, and getting in touch with nature. This relaxed and interactive workshop is ideal for children and families to explore natural building materials, create art, and try out basic building techniques in a fun, creative environment. Following the family day, our specialized workshops dive deeper into natural building methods and are perfect for adults and older children. These workshops combine learning with hands-on experience as participants work on a live project and see their efforts come to life!Workshops include: Discounted Workshop Packages:Participants can choose to attend one individual workshop or purchase a discounted package for 4 workshops. Each workshop is offered on two dates, so you can pick the dates that work best for you. Please return to the event collection page to see these offers. Statement of Intent: The Earth Building Workshop Series, hosted by Bisque-kit in collaboration with Ark Eden and Ania Chorzępa, is a temporary, educational initiative focused on teaching natural building methods in a hands-on and environmentally conscious way. The project is not commercial in nature and is intended to support environmental education, community engagement, and creativity. All structures built during the workshops are: Any elements constructed during the workshops are either: The goal is to explore sustainable construction techniques while minimizing environmental impact and remaining respectful of existing planning and building regulations. The team commits to responsible site use, maintaining safety and cleanliness at all times, and keeping communication open with relevant authorities and the local community. Workshop Safety & Participation Disclaimer All participants in the Earth Building Workshop Series do so at their own risk. While the activities are designed to be low-risk and suitable for beginners, they involve natural building materials such as clay, sand, straw, bamboo, and tools like trowels or shovels. By attending, participants acknowledge that: -They will follow the instructions of the workshop leaders at all times -They understand the nature of the physical activities involved, including manual mixing, lifting, and sculpting with earth materials -Children under 16 must be supervised by a parent or designated responsible adult The organizers will provide basic protective items (e.g. gloves), hydration stations, and shaded areas, but recommend that participants bring appropriate clothing, footwear, and sun protection. The workshop area will be kept clean and hazard-free to the best of our ability, and the team reserves the right to stop or adjust any activity for safety reasons.

description: ✨【New Moon能量療癒夜：七星陣能量淨化 × 頌缽靜心冥想】✨ 🌙 活動主題「以神聖幾何與高頻能量，啟動內在光之流動」 🌟 導師團隊 🌟- CV Chan（主力能量療癒師）▸ 量度能量狀態(脈輪)▸ 以Orgonite 七星陣構築高維能量結界，淨化集體氣場▸ 臼井靈氣傳導，平衡脈輪與創傷印記▸ 美國NGH認證催眠引導，釋放深層制約 - Nickie So（頌缽與冥想引導）▸ 頌缽音頻療癒，瓦解能量淤塞，重整身心諧振▸ 帶領靜心冥想，錨定內在寧靜 💫 活動亮點1. 七星陣能量場啟動：▸ Orgonite（奧剛）礦石結合神聖幾何，轉化負能量為生命流（Orgone）。▸ 參與者將置身陣法中央，接受「能量沐浴」，強化個人光體。2. 雙頻療癒協作：▸ 靈氣 + 頌缽 雙重高頻震動，同步清理轉化能量場。3. 集體意識共修：▸ 透過團體冥想，串聯彼此能量場，共創療癒倍增效應。 【New Moon能量療癒夜：七星陣能量淨化 × 頌缽靜心冥想】📅 日期：7月25日(五)⏰ 時間：8:00-10:00pm📍 地點：尖沙咀諾士佛臺4-5號東港商業大廈13樓03室收費：$199 🌿 適合對象- 渴望深度能量清理者- 正經歷生命轉換期，需穩定內在者- 對靈性成長、能量療癒有興趣 「當七星陣的光網升起，我們都是彼此療癒的鏡子。」 💬 溫馨提示：活動後建議多飲水，允許自己3日內情緒自然流動 【查詢及報名】 WhatsApp: 63821806 (或Signal) 可按 https://wa.me/85263821806 FB: facebook.com/singingbowlhongkong IG: instagram.com/singingbowlhongkong

title: Otherwise Employed
summary: A peer support group for anyone who is unemployed, not working full time, or finding it hard by The New Normal. All are welcome.
organizer: The New Normal Charity Hong Kong
venue: 16/f Chun Wo Commercial Centre, 23-27 Wing Wo Street, Sheung Wan, HKI, Hong Kong, Sheung Wan, HKI
description: What it isOtherwise Employed is a peer group for anyone who is unemployed or not working full time and finding it hard. Lots of things make being ‘Otherwise Employed’ hard. You might be in this position involuntarily, experiencing financial pressures, loss of identity, routine, or purpose, facing rejection in your job search, feeling lonely, or uncertain about the future. This is a forum for people to share the difficult emotions around not being in full-time employment, which provides not only income but also an identity, structure to your day, social contact, and often a purpose. What this is not - A forum to discuss the practicalities of job searches - A networking opportunity What happens A peer support group is where people come together to share personal stories, listen and support one another with kindness. You will be welcomed by two hosts who are trained TNN volunteers with lived experience in the topic of the group. It is normal to feel nervous, and sharing can be a big decision. Remember you are deserving of care and support. You are welcome to join us and just listen. Our hosts will welcome you and provide an introduction, then we will ask you to introduce yourself and your reason for joining us. From then on there is no pressure to speak. Our hosts will facilitate conversation. A peer support group is a supportive space where people can: Share stories and how our experiences are currently impacting our lives Talk about our feelings and emotions Share and discuss coping strategies Group guidelines We have some basic guidance that we ask everyone to adhere to, to ensure this remains an inclusive space for everyone: Please note As a peer support group, this group is for peers to share their personal struggles and support one another. Attendees are welcome to come and listen but it is not a space to observe. You should attend to engage in peer support. It is not a space for students to contribute to their studies, for clinicians to observe, or for the press unless written agreement from the charity has been obtained. Who are The New Normal Charity? We are a Hong Kong S88 registered charity. The New Normal Hong Kong has been hosting our free peer support groups in Hong Kong since 2022. Our groups are facilitated by volunteers. While our hosts are trained to facilitate, we are not mental health professionals in this space. We do not give advice, we provide space for all of you to share, connect and support. Nobody should ever feel alone, and there is always somebody who can relate to your story. www.thenewnormalcharityhk.org If you are in crisis and don’t feel like you can keep yourself safe there are immediate services available. 危機求助熱線如果你覺得你不能保證自己的安全 Samaritans 2341 7227 (until 10pm) 2389 2222 (24/7) Caritas 18288 SPS Hotline 23820000 Address WYNG 16/F, Chun Wo Commercial Centre 23-27 Wing Wo Street, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong Island How to get there 2 minute walk from Sheung Wan Station:From Exit E1, turn right and walk along Des Voeux Rd Central. Cross Wing Lok Street, then turn right onto Wing Wo Street (the first street after you cross). The building will be on your left.

title: Pik-Sum & friends: Very Chinese Music
summary: Join Pik-Sum and friends for a mesmerizing evening of Erhu at the century stone house this July!
venue: allure customised hair, 3 School Street Tai Hang, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Step into the enchanting century-old Allure stone house for an extraordinary evening of ancient Chinese melodies that will leave you spellbound. This time, renowned Erhu virtuoso Chan Pik-Sum returns with an exciting new ensemble to captivate audiences once again. With the hauntingly beautiful sounds of the Erhu, Yangqin, and Sanxian, prepare for a sensory journey that seamlessly blends tradition with timeless artistry. This is more than music—it’s an experience steeped in elegance, emotion, and undeniable charm. 走進Allure的百年石屋，享受一場令人著迷的古代中國旋律之夜。著名二胡演奏家陳璧沁此次帶著全新組合回歸，再次為觀眾帶來扣人心弦的音樂體驗。伴隨著二胡、揚琴與三弦那動人心魄的悅耳聲音，準備好展開一場融合傳統與永恆藝術的感官旅程。這不僅僅是音樂，而是一場充滿優雅、情感與無法抗拒魅力的非凡體驗。 Explore the Artistry of Musicians The Sirens emerged out of informal acoustic jams and late-night harmonising in the street after closing time to create a unique alternative folk sound. Made up of four Lamma women: Aleks (fiddle), Erin (guitar), Jeni (cello) and Lebo (cajon) re-interpret everything from traditional Irish to The Eurythmics, by way of Neil Young, Eva Cassidy, and Amy Winehouse. The Sirens’ harmonies lean towards a mysterious, moody sound evocative of their mythological namesakes luring sailors lost at sea. Allure Music Salon: Evenings of Music and Mastery Allure Music Salon, nestled in Tai Hang's historic Century Stone House, Hong Kong, hosts enthralling musical evenings and workshops. Our Incubating series and Masters events spotlight emerging talents and seasoned maestros, fostering connections and inspiring audiences. Join us for a transformative experience where creativity shapes the future of music. Allure Music Salon 位於香港大坑歷史悠久的世紀石屋，舉辦迷人的音樂之夜和工作坊。我們的孵化系列和大師活動突顯新興才能與資深大師，促進互動並啟發觀眾。加入我們，體驗在創意塑造音樂未來的轉變性體驗。 Allure Friends Privacy PolicyAllure Music Salon is committed to protecting your privacy and complies with the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance. This policy outlines our practices regarding the collection, use, sharing, and protection of personal data. Types of Personal Data Collected: name, email and phone number Purpose: Identity verification, Security and Activity updates Personal data is treated confidentially. We will use a third-party email system to send you emails. Personal data is retained only as long as necessary for the purpose for which it was collected and is protected using adequate security measures to prevent unauthorized access or loss. Access to and Correction of Personal Data You have the right to access and correct your personal data held by Allure Music Salon. Requests can be made to Allure Music Salon via email at alluremusicsalon@gmail.com or through other provided contact methods. 承諾保護隱私 Allure Music Salon 致力於保護您的隱私，並遵守《個人資料（私隱）條例》。本政策概述了我們關於收集、使用、分享及保護個人資料的做法。 收集的個人資料類型: 姓名、電郵及電話號碼 收集目的：身份驗證、保安及通知最新活動 資料會保密處理。我們會使用第三方電郵系統向您發送電郵。 個人資料僅在收集目的所需的時間內保留，並採用適當的安全措施防止未經授權的存取或丟失。 存取及更正個人資料 您有權存取和更正Allure Music Salon 持有的您的個人資料。可以通過電郵至 alluremusicsalon@gmail.com 或其他提供的聯繫方式，提出請求。 Allure Incubating Fridays is exclusive event series (Music Appreciation Workshop) presented by Allure Music Salon. Allure Incubating Fridays 是由 Allure Music Salon 提供獨家活動系列 (音樂鑑賞工作坊)。

title: Revamp x Dara: SIP N' SWAP Party
summary: Revamp invites you to it's 1st ever clothing swap party happening at Dara! Exchange your pre-loved items, enjoy drinks, music & good vibes!
venue: Dara, 189 Queen's Road West #Shop 3, 5-6, G/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: When & Where 19 July 2025, 11:30 am – 5:30 pm Dara Shop 3,5-6, G/F, Soho 189, 189 Queen’s Road West Sai Ying Pun Why Join? Revamp x Dara: SIP N' SWAP Party Get ready for the SIP N' SWAP Party hosted by Revamp at Dara! Join us on Saturday, 19th July 2025, and immerse yourself in a vibrant atmosphere celebrating sustainable living and conscious fashion. Exchange your pre-loved items and discover eco-friendly treasures while enjoying drinks, music and good vibes all around. Embrace a greener lifestyle by choosing secondhand. Sustainable Shop Alongside the clothing swap, we are excited to host a curated selection of clothes, bags and shoes for sale. All funds will go directly into enhancing Revamp's curated collections and future events. “How To Swap” Guide Swapping is an easy an enjoyable process - our 8 simple steps allow you to maximise each experience and successfully rotate their wardrobes with value for value. 1. PURCHASE your entry ticket online. Ticket priced at HKD100. Each ticket comes with one (1) FREE drink and one (1) raffle* entry. *Get a chance to win a HKD500 DARA dining voucher. 2. Clean your wardrobe and SELECT up to 10 items** to trade in - ALL Sizes, Shapes, Styles & Colours are encouraged. **If you would like to bring more than 10 items, these will be classfied as a donation and will not be eligable for additional swap credits. 3. Be sure to CHECK each item for defects. Items must meet our Exchange Eligibility standards to be accepted – to ensure you maximise your swopping experience, please only bring along clothes that are in good condition, good enough to give to a friend. 4. Come along to our pop-up swap event and TRADE IN your items for swap credits. We will cross check your items upon arrival and you'll receive a wrist tag with the number of swap credits indicating how many items you can take. 1 item of clothing = 1 swap credit 5. SIP N' SWAP: Enjoy your spree! - our racks will be filled with other attendees pre-loved clothing. 6. We highly encourage you TRY on all the clothing before checking out. We want to ensure all items go to a home where they will be worn and enjoyed. 7. Once you’re done looking through the racks and tried on your chosen items, CHECK-OUT your clothing in exchange for the number of credits you have. Any left-over credits will be converted into raffle draw entries. 8. Congratulations, you have now REVAMPed your wardrobe -- the sustainable way by choosing secondhand. Wear, enjoy and love your new (to you) clothes - Tag us in your swap finds @revamp.hongkong and see you at our next pop-up!

title: Rhythms of Connection: Parent-Child Djembe at The Wanch (27-07-2025)
summary: Rhythms of Connection: Parent-Child Djembe Experience at The Wanch (Sunday 27th July 2025) 親子節奏連繫：非洲鼓體驗工作坊 (5-11years 合5至11歲嘅小朋友參加)
venue: The Wanch, 90 Jaffe Road #1/F, Wanchai, HKI, Hong Kong, Wanchai, HKI
description: Are you looking for a unique way to bond with your children that's both fun and enriching? Look no further than The Wanch's new Sunday djembe drumming family workshops!This workshop is tailored for children aged 5–11 years old These exciting workshops are designed to:Strengthen parent-child bonds through shared musical experiencesEnhance communication skills and emotional expressionProvide a stress-relieving outlet for both parents and childrenCreate lasting memories filled with rhythm and laughterImmerse you in vibrant African culture Join this unique opportunity to connect through the universal language of rhythm! Rhythms of Connection: Parent-Child Djembe Experience at The Wanch (The Wanch, 1/F, Henan Building, 90 Jaffe Road, Wan Chai) Sunday 27th July 20253pm - 4:30pm (actual workshop is at 3:30pm - 4:30pm)HK$280 per child (with one accompanying parent)HK$420 per child (with two accompanying parents)(This workshop is tailored for children aged 5–11 years old Limited spots available. About DJIJOR Ghana We’re thrilled to collaborate with DJIJOR Ghana, a renowned dance and drumming company affiliated with the Centre for National Culture in Accra, Ghana. Established in 2014, DJIJOR Ghana is celebrated for its talented performers who bring vibrant African rhythms and dances to life. From Ghanaian traditions like Adowa and Kpanlogo to dances from across Africa—including Senegal, Zimbabwe, and Nigeria—DJIJOR’s expertise guarantees an authentic and unforgettable experience親子節奏連繫：非洲鼓體驗工作坊 @ The Wanch (2025年7月27日 星期日)工作坊適合5至11歲嘅小朋友參加。想搵啲好玩又有意義嘅活動同小朋友一齊開心一下？The Wanch 今次推出嘅星期日家庭非洲鼓工作坊，絕對啱晒你哋！ 呢個工作坊好有趣，仲可以： - 透過音樂同小朋友拉近關係 - 幫助大家學識點樣表達自己嘅感受同溝通 - 俾家長同小朋友一個好放鬆嘅減壓時刻 - 創造一啲充滿節奏同笑聲嘅美好回憶 - 感受非洲文化嘅活力同魅力 快啲嚟參加呢個特別嘅活動，用音樂節奏同小朋友建立深層連繫啦！ 活動詳情： 親子節奏連繫：非洲鼓體驗工作坊 @ The Wanch (灣仔謝斐道90號河南大廈1樓) 日期：2025年7月27日（星期日） 時間：下午3點至4:30點（工作坊時間係3:30至4:30） 費用：每位小朋友 HK$280（包埋一位家長陪同）HK$420 (包埋兩位家長陪同) 名額有限，記得早啲報名呀！ 關於 DJIJOR Ghana 我哋好開心可以同 DJIJOR Ghana 合作！呢個團隊係加納阿克拉國家文化中心旗下嘅舞蹈同打擊樂團，2014年成立，佢哋嘅表演者超有才華，將非洲節奏同舞蹈玩到出神入化！無論係加納傳統舞蹈例如 Adowa 同 Kpanlogo，定係非洲其他地方（例如塞內加爾、津巴布韋、尼日利亞）嘅舞蹈，DJIJOR 一定會俾你哋一個真實又難忘嘅文化體驗！

title: RICS Hong Kong Conference
summary: The Next Era of Hong Kong: Shaping a Resilient and Innovative Future
organizer: RICS Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors
venue: Hong Kong Ocean Park Marriott Hotel, 180 Wong Chuk Hang Road Aberdeen, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: In-person event 12th September 2025 09:00-17:00 HKT Hong Kong’s property sector is undergoing a profound transformation amid shifting global economic conditions. As the industry grapples with uncertainty, opportunities arise for forward-thinking strategies that foster resilience and sustainable growth. The RICS Hong Kong Conference serves as a premier platform, bringing together influential stakeholders from government, industry, and academia. This forum will explore key developments in public-private partnerships, technological innovation, and sustainable finance—critical drivers shaping the future of the built environment. Through insightful discussions and expert-led sessions, participants will gain valuable perspectives on emerging market trends, policy directions, and investment strategies that will define Hong Kong’s competitiveness on the global stage. Attendees will engage in thought-provoking exchanges aimed at crafting a strategic blueprint for a more adaptive, efficient, and internationally integrated Hong Kong. By fostering collaboration and knowledge sharing, this conference will empower professionals to lead the next wave of transformation, ensuring a future-ready property market that meets the evolving demands of businesses, investors, and communities. Join us to be part of this essential dialogue—where expertise meets vision, innovation drives progress, and new pathways emerge for Hong Kong’s built environment. For more information, please visit our website.

title: 【文化沙龍】劉偉民 Ronny Lau《意大利酒王 Barolo 白松露菌味覺顛峰之旅》暨試酒環節
summary: Ronny 將與大家細味他多年來穿梭於意大利的試酒及美饌經歷，探索葡萄酒與風土人情和歷史文化的微妙關係，以及特別分享葡萄酒主題旅遊享用酒王及白松露的色香味體驗。現場設試酒環節，賓客可即場品試 Barolo 及 Barbaresco，感受酒王及酒后魅力。
venue: 旅遊研究所 - 旺角中華漆廠大廈 6 樓, 旺角廣東道1163號 中華漆廠大廈 6 樓, Mong Kok, KOW, Hong Kong, Mong Kok, KOW
description: 【文化沙龍】劉偉民 Ronny Lau《意大利酒王 Barolo 白松露菌味覺顛峰之旅》暨試酒環節 文化沙龍詳情： 日期：2025-07-22 （二) 時間：1900-2030 地點：旺角廣東道1163號中華漆廠大廈 6 樓 內容簡介： Barolo被譽為「酒中王」，以其卓越的陳年能力和嚴格的監管聞名。2014年，Barolo和Barbaresco的葡萄園被UNESCO列入世界文化遺產。白松露菌則因難以培植和短暫的收成期，被稱為餐桌上的鑽石，主要產於意大利的Alba，每年吸引來自世界各地美食家慕名而去。酒評人Ronny 與大家細味他多年來穿梭於意大利的試酒及美饌經歷，探索葡萄酒與風土人情和歷史文化的微妙關係，以及特別分享葡萄酒主題旅遊享用酒王及白松露的色香味體驗。現場品試 Barolo 及 Barbaresco，感受酒王及酒后魅力。 劉偉民 Ronny Lau： 香港酒評人協會創會主席，前大中華酒評人協會主席。八十年代開始撰寫酒評，著有《傾倒葡萄酒》等及主編葡萄酒書。2011年起出任上海國際葡萄酒品評賽聯合主席至今。2012 年獲意大利酒莊邀請釀酒，成為首個 Super Tuscan 華人釀酒師。2016 年獲意大利對外貿易委員會邀請設計及於內地任教《意大利葡萄酒及烈酒課程》。2022 年獲意大利商務專員公署邀請設計及主持「意酒中菜」中國 8 大菜系晚宴系列。 🌟行程亮點 ‧意大利葡萄酒達人 Ronny Lau 全程嚮導 ‧ 參觀多家 Barolo 明星酒莊 每餐精選葡萄酒配搭 ‧ 兩家米芝蓮星餐廳用膳 享用三餐白松露菜式 ‧ 藝術家指導葡萄酒繪畫班 咖啡及朱古力博物館 ‧ 參觀耶穌裹屍布博物館 都靈城市漫遊 ‧ 歐洲最大 Shopping Outlet 血拚 【意大利酒王Barolo白松露味覺顛峰之旅】 📅日期：2025 年 11 月 15 日（六）至 11 月 22 日（六）（米蘭集合） 📝團號：EXTITMXP202511A *凡於 7 月 25 日或之前報名，並繳交 HKD 5,000 作為留位費，可享團費每位減 HKD $1,000 早鳥優惠。 ‧若對最終團費或行程內容有異議，參加者可選擇退出並全數退還已繳款項。 ‧如有任何爭議，一期旅研保留最終解釋及決定權。 🔥🔥🔥本團現正接受報名 🔥🔥🔥 🌿機會難逢 名額有限 額滿即止！ 🌿如欲報名，請 WhatsApp 6618 3022 與旅行社職員接洽 🌿或致電 2713 0998 查詢 🌿或電郵至 info@extravelism.com 旅遊研究所｜Extravelism 旅行社牌照號碼：354367 https://www.instagram.com/extravelism/

title: SEED FARMERS MARKET 耔籽農墟
summary: 【有機蔬菜・農產加工・環保天然・香港品牌・本地手作】 | 【Organic Vegetables・Agricultural Products・Eco Friendly Products・Hong Kong brands・Handmade】
organizer: 香港有機生活發展基金
description: 2008年1月9日，SEED主辦的「中環天星碼頭農墟」正式誕生，現已改名為「SEED 耔籽農墟」。作為唯一一個平日固定農墟，有別於其他假日農墟，我們聚集的小農戶多以小量生產，精品蔬菜為主，不乏別具特色的有機蔬菜、加工農產等。農墟堅持保持簡單、直接、充滿濃濃人情味的運作方式，讓農夫與市民能夠互動交流，讓每位農夫的聲音也能夠被聽見。 營運至今，由數個農場開始，現已發展成擁有十多個農場及本地小店的固定農墟，更吸引新晉農青參與，更與不同農場、機構及團體合作，衍生出多元化的社區項目。

summary: 儀式中，會以傳統方式召喚四方位，以及新時代的咨詢技巧，為各人提供能量流動及儀式轉化嘅契機，為未來下半年種下蛻變種子。
venue: 香港執業催眠師中心, 4-5號 諾士佛臺 13樓03室, HK, KOW, Hong Kong, HK, KOW
description: 《Shamanic Drum Circle 薩滿鼓療癒儀式》 聲音是能量的載體，可以輕鬆地導入不同的訊息於人體各部份，從而作出平衝與療癒。 傳統薩滿/Medicine Man會透過唱頌、擊鼓、沙鈴，以及羽毛和手療為人平衡身體、情緒以及人生志業等各方面。 ✨這天為滿月之夜，能量滿滿的日子，配合天時，是重組個人能量的大好時機，參加者必定煥然一新！ 儀式中，會以傳統方式召喚四方位，以及新時代的咨詢技巧，為各人提供能量流動及儀式轉化嘅契機，為未來下半年種下蛻變種子。 您將穫得什麼 💝能夠為自己和他人療癒身心靈的能力 💝深入了解自己內在的限制信念並有效清除根治 💝「負向」情緒的深度清理 💝「正向」目標的意識強化 💝心想事成的顯化能力 💝能量閱讀和未來解讀的能力 適合對象 - 如果你是： ✨對人生、前路感到迷茫 ✨受原生家庭問題困擾 ✨感情/婚姻不如意 ✨內心焦燥、空虛無助 ✨工作不理想，未能發揮 ✨金錢匱乏，入不敷支 ✨身體/情緒出現問題 ✨有興趣成為療癒師助人自助的人 【Shamanic Drum Circle 薩滿鼓療癒儀式】 主持：Keerti Anurag（蜻蜓） 日期：8月8日(五) 時間：7:30 -9:30 pm 地址：尖沙咀諾士佛臺4-5號東港商業大廈13樓03室 費用：$888 【查詢及報名】 WhatsApp: 63821806 (或Signal) 可按 https://wa.me/85263821806 ～～～～～～～～～～～～～～～ 【導師 Keerti Anurag (蜻蜓)】 Shamanic Practitioner 薩滿治療師 Meditation Facilitator 靜心團體帶領人 Zen Counselor 禪咨詢師 Psychospiritual Healer 身心靈工作者 Florist 花藝師 Psychotherapist 心靈治療師 A Psychospiritual Healer who familiar with many different types of Body-Mind-Spirit/ Wellness approach, specify in Osho and Seth material. Started working in this industry since 2011 as a BMS Center Manager. Travelling, Working and Learning all over the world since 2014, have been working in Eco-Village in Australia, Meditation Resort in Pune, India, studying Ecology and Spirituality in Schumacher College, UK. A Shamanic Practitioner who initiated in 2012 by a half-blood Cherokee, have many experience on joining participating, assisting and facilitating in different types of the ceremony in Taiwan, Singapore, Thailand, Tibet, Cambodia, Japan, Britain, Australia, Netherlands, Peru, Brazil and Gabon. Participating in the Ayahuasca Ceremony in Peru and Iboga Ceremony in Gabon; Staying with the Aboriginal in Iga Warta, S.A. Australia; Having Sainte Daime Ceremony in Netherland and Making Sainte Daime in Brazil with the Sainte Daime Church. A Psychotherapist who major in Psychology and doing research on Wellness, Mindfulness, and Happiness. Embracing holistic living-style and mindfulness living. Trained be a Meditation Facilitator, Zen Counsellor in Pune, studied about holistic science in UK, worked in Eco-Village in Australia. 提倡覺知革命 年輕時毅然放棄學業開始走身心靈的路，學習不同門派新時代資料及多種不同類型的身心靈療癒法，當中尤其熟悉賽斯和奧修資料。2011年全職成為身心靈中心經理。 2014年開始旅居生活，學習生活工作足跡遍各地，曾於澳洲工作假期、印度工作靜心和在英國讀書，在不同文化遊歷拓展意識，同時亦不忘推廣身心靈工作。 熱愛薩滿文化 2009年一次偶然遇上薩滿學習上的恩師，有幸完成多年訓練，通過考試及儀式成為一名薩滿治療師，期間亦四處尋訪世界各地不同傳統薩滿或薩滿治療師學習和第一身體會各種薩滿治療手法和精神價值。 曾在世界各地協助進行、參與、學習和體驗各種大大小小的儀式，當中包括：台灣、新加坡、泰國、西藏、柬埔寨、日本、英國、澳洲、荷蘭、秘魯、巴西和加蓬，及於南澳原住民社區旅居打工換宿一個月，學習或體驗不同文化背後的身心靈精神面貌。 奉行意識生活 在外地生活期間，見到外國身心靈工作者多結合整全生活方式HOLISTIC LIFESTYLE，提倡過著有意識的生活MINDFUL LIVING，深感富覺知意識生活態度的整全方式，是人類身心靈健康的基石，曾在澳洲和英國生態村學習和居住，對於健康飲食及環保生活具有獨特觸角和經驗。 相信天人合一 生活是一場修行，在修習身心靈的過程中，有幸認識陰陽派五行氣脈、印度脈輪系統和現代生命能量醫學等學說。從不同老師的教學演說中，歸納出對大宇宙(實相世界)和小宇宙(人類身體)之認知，從而看出每個源自於不同地域的學說系統之共通點，以不同的方式說著同樣的「真相」。
