title: Silk & Smoke: Allure Chet Baker Night ( Incubating Series)
summary: Join us for an evening tribute to Chet Baker, featuring the soulful sounds of KSO! 與我們一起向 Chet Baker 致敬的夜晚，感受 KSO 的深情樂音！
venue: allure customised hair, 3 School Street Tai Hang, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Silk & Smoke: Allure Chet Baker Night Chet Baker’s music drips with silky elegance and smoky allure. His haunting trumpet, intimate voice, and turbulent charm immortalized him as jazz’s timeless romantic, forever painting nocturnal melodies of love and longing. 絲絨與煙霧：Chet Baker 的迷人之夜 Chet Baker 的音樂散發著絲絨般的優雅與煙霧般的魅力。他令人心碎的小號、親密的歌聲與動蕩的魅力，將他永遠定格為爵士界永恆的浪漫詩人，描繪愛與渴望的夜晚旋律。 Immerse yourself in a special tribute to the legendary jazz trumpeter Chet Baker. Featuring the talented Kowloon Swing Outfit, the evening promises a heartfelt reinterpretation of Baker's soulful melodies and intimate style, which have left an indelible mark on jazz. 誠邀您參與向傳奇爵士樂小號手 Chet Baker 致敬的特別活動。當晚將由出色的九龍搖擺樂隊（Kowloon Swing Outfit）帶來對 Baker 那充滿靈魂的旋律和親密風格的深情演繹，這些都是他在爵士樂界留下的不朽印記。 Photo & Video : Foo king Wai, Fuji（ #符敬偉 @foofoto_p ) Featured Band Kowloon Swing Outfit (@thekowloonswingoutfit) - David Batchelor (Trumpet & Vocals, @davidbatch) - Bruce Hunnisett (Saxophone, @brucehunnisett) -Toshi Horiguchi (Piano ,@toshi_origuchi) - Jimmy Pittman (Bass, @jimmy.pittman.90) -Carlos Vieira (Percussion) ✨ Tai Hang’s Allure Pass 2025 Discover the charm of Tai Hang, where hair, music, and cuisine blend seamlessly into a unique urban escape. 💇‍♀️🎶🍴 From chic styling to live melodies and culinary delights, this chill community invites you to explore, indulge, and unwind. 🌟 Your Allure Pass opens doors to exclusive perks—just show it and enjoy. ✨ 大坑 Allure Pass 2025 探索大坑的獨特魅力，感受髮型設計、音樂與美食的完美交融。💇‍♀️🎶🍴 從時尚造型到動人旋律，再到美味佳餚，邀您放鬆身心，盡情享受。🌟 憑Allure Pass尊享專屬禮遇! Kowloon Swing Outfit Led by David Batchelor, the Kowloon Swing Outfit spans a diverse range of jazz styles from traditional to modal jazz of the late 1960s. The band has attracted large audiences on multiple occasions and frequently collaborates with swing dancers to provide a lively and accessible music experience. 由 David Batchelor 領銜，Kowloon Swing Outfit 橫跨從傳統到1960年代末期的模態爵士的多元爵士樂風格。這支樂隊曾在多個場合吸引眾多觀眾，並經常與搖擺舞者合作，帶來充滿活力且易於接近的音樂體驗。 Explore the Artistry of Musicians David Batchelor David Batchelor, with 30 years of international experience performing in Europe and Asia, has a rich and diverse musical style that spans from classical to rock, and of course, jazz. His major influences include jazz greats like Chet Baker, Miles Davis, Louis Armstrong, and Clark Terry. David Batchelor 擁有30年的國際經驗，曾在歐洲和亞洲演出，他的音樂風格豐富多元，從古典到搖滾，當然還有爵士樂。他的主要影響包括爵士樂巨匠如 Chet Baker、Miles Davis、Louis Armstrong 和 Clark Terry。 Toshi Horiguchi A Tokyo native, Toshi's musical journey was ignited during his teenage years when he discovered the enchanting sounds of soul music and jazz, particularly influenced by the captivating styles of Marvin Gaye and Bill Evans. Based in Hong Kong, Toshi adopts an adventurous approach to his crati, fearlessly delving into a wide range of musical genres that have influenced his artistic sensibilities. Through collaborations with local and international musicians, he blends diverse musical influences, resulting in performances that transcend boundaries and captivate audiences. As he continues to navigate and contribute to the dynamic music scene in Hong Kong, Toshi remains commited to exploring new horizons and establishing himself as a versatile and dynamic force within the everevolving tapestry of the city's musical landscape. 來自東京的Toshi在青少年時期發現了靈魂音樂和爵士的迷人聲音，特別受到Marvin Gaye和Bill Evans的風格影響啟發。目前居住在香港的Toshi採取大膽的音樂探索方式，無畏地深入多種音樂類型，這些都深刻影響了他的藝術感性。通過與本地和國際音樂家的合作，他融合了多元的音樂影響，創造出超越界限並吸引觀眾的表演。隨著他繼續在香港動態的音樂場景中前行和貢獻，Toshi致力於探索新的視野，力求在這個不斷演變的音樂織錦中成為一名多才多藝且充滿活力的重要人物。 Jimmy Pitman Jimmy Pitman, originally from Chicago, Illinois, is a bassist and educator currently based in Hong Kong. Since arriving in HK in 2012, he has been gigging consistently on both bass guitar and upright bass. He has gained a reputtion as a first call player for his fluency in numerous styles and tasteful accompaniment. Jimmy has performed recently at the 2023 Make Music Festival, 2021 Hong Kong West Kowloon Jazz Festival, the 2019 Hangzhou “Jazz On The Lake” International Jazz Festival, the 2019 “Art Of Crati” crati beer festival at the HK Asia Society, and the 2018 HK International Jazz Festival. 原籍美國伊利諾伊州芝加哥的Jimmy Pitman，是一位低音大提琴兼音樂教育家，目前定居於香港。自2012年來到香港以來，他一直積極參與電貝斯和低音大提琴的演出，以其流暢的多種音樂風格和高雅的伴奏技巧而被認為是首屈一指的演奏者。Jimmy近期的演出包括2023年的香港音樂節、2021年香港西九龍爵士音樂節、2019年杭州“湖畔爵士”國際爵士音樂節、2019年香港亞洲社會“藝術與手工啤酒”節，以及2018年香港國際爵士音樂節。 CARLOS VIERA Carlos Vieira's drumming is the rhythmic heartbeat of any musical group, effortlessly adapting from jazz to funk to pop. Originating from Lisbon, Portugal, Carlos has studied an eclectic mix of musical styles with legendary musicians in global music capitals. His career has taken him around the world, performing with pioneering artists from Portugal and beyond, and sharing his knowledge at the Hot Club Jazz School of Lisbon. His global footprint includes performances in numerous countries and residencies at luxury venues like the Mandarin Oriental in Hong Kong and The Ritz Carlton in Shanghai. Carlos's beats are a testament to his passion and versatility, laying down the rhythm for audiences worldwide. 卡洛斯·維埃拉的鼓點是任何樂隊的節奏心臟，他能毫不費力地從爵士樂轉換到放克樂再到流行樂。他來自葡萄牙里斯本，曾在全球音樂之都與傳奇音樂家學習多種混合音樂風格。他的職業生涯讓他周遊世界，與來自葡萄牙及其他地方的開創性藝術家合作表演，並在里斯本的熱門爵士俱樂部爵士學校分享他的知識。他的全球足跡包括在多個國家的表演和在如香港文華東方酒店和上海麗思卡爾頓酒店等豪華場所的駐場表演。卡洛斯的節奏是對他的熱情和多才多藝的證明，為全世界的觀眾奠定節奏。 This event serves as a dynamic hub for emerging and experienced artists to converge, explore, and refine their artistic talents. It's an opportunity for meaningful connections and creative exchanges within our community. Whether you are an integral part of the jazz community or newly exploring its rich history, join us in a unique setting that fosters the evolution of music and nurtures a community shaping the future of the arts. 這個活動是新興和經驗豐富的藝術家聚集、探索和提升藝術才能的活躍中心。它是在我們私密社群內建立意義連接和創意交流的機會。無論您是爵士樂社群的一份子，還是剛開始探索其豐富的歷史，歡迎參加我們獨特的活動，共同促進音樂的演進，塑造藝術社群。 Allure Friends Privacy PolicyAllure Music Salon is committed to protecting your privacy and complies with the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance. This policy outlines our practices regarding the collection, use, sharing, and protection of personal data. Types of Personal Data Collected - name, email and phone number Personal data is used to send you messages. If you choose not to receive such communications, an opt-out option is available. Personal data is treated confidentially, disclosed only to authorized personnel or as required by law. We will use a third-party email system to send you emails. Personal data is retained only as long as necessary for the purpose for which it was collected and is protected using adequate security measures to prevent unauthorized access or loss. Access to and Correction of Personal Data You have the right to access and correct your personal data held by Allure Music Salon. Requests can be made to Allure Music Salon via email at alluremusicsalon@gmail.com or through other provided contact methods. 承諾保護隱私 Allure Music Salon 致力於保護您的隱私，並遵守《個人資料（私隱）條例》。本政策概述了我們關於收集、使用、分享及保護個人資料的做法。 收集的個人資料類型 姓名、電郵及電話號碼 個人資料用於向您發送資訊。如果您選擇不接收此類通訊，可以選擇退出。 個人資料會保密處理，僅向授權人員披露或根據法律要求披露。我們會使用第三方電郵系統向您發送電郵。 個人資料僅在收集目的所需的時間內保留，並採用適當的安全措施防止未經授權的存取或丟失。 存取及更正個人資料 您有權存取和更正Allure Music Salon 持有的您的個人資料。可以通過電郵至 alluremusicsalon@gmail.com 或其他提供的聯繫方式，提出請求。 Allure Incubating Fridays is exclusive event series (Music Appreciation Workshop) presented by Allure Music Salon. Allure Incubating Fridays 是由 Allure Music Salon 提供獨家活動系列 (音樂鑑賞工作坊)。

title: Summer Nights @ Shaw Auditorium: Robot Dreams
summary: Join us at Shaw Auditorium for a summer screening of "Robot Dreams," a heartwarming animated film that touch your heart!
venue: Main Hall, Shaw Auditorium, HKUST, HONG KONG, NT, Hong Kong, HONG KONG, NT
description: 逸夫演藝中心誠邀您參加盛夏電影放映活動，一同欣賞溫馨感人的動畫電影《汪汪夢裡人》。本片以狗狗與機器人之間的深厚友情為主題，透過精緻的動畫畫面與電影歌曲，細膩描繪孤獨、夢想與現實交織的情感旅程。全片無對白，但每個動作與表情都勝過千言萬語。這將是一場讓您放鬆心情、感受真摯情感的觀影體驗，誠邀您蒞臨共度美好時光！ Shaw Auditorium cordially invites you to a summer film screening featuring the heartwarming animated film "Robot Dreams." This touching story showcases the profound friendship between a dog and a robot, brought to life through exquisite animation and music. With no dialogue, the film conveys deep emotions through gestures and expressions. Join us for this captivating cinematic experience that promises to soothe your mind and touch your heart! 故事簡介 榮獲奧斯卡最佳動畫長片提名，感動橫掃全球60+項大獎及提名，被譽為媲美《優獸大都會》及《星聲夢裡人》的年度最佳電影！單身狗狗厭倦了寂寞的獨居生活，決定購買智能機械人作伴。二人一拍即合，日夜漫遊紐約大街小巷。正當他們以為找到人生中的彼此，命運卻在一次沙灘狂歡後將他們硬生生拆散。狗狗帶著思念回復孤獨的生活日常，機械人則獨自躺在沙灘上幻想著再次回到狗狗身邊……在這場無盡的思念旅程中，有沒有一個重來的機會？ Synopsis Based on a graphic novel by Sara Varon, Goya-Award-winning director Pablo Berger’s first venture into animation is a colourful, vibrant and touching buddy drama. To escape solitude, Dog assembles Robot from a build-it-yourself kit. Setting off on a whimsical exploration of New York City, the new best friends develop an inseparable bond as they savour curbside hotdogs and roller-skate through Central Park. However, their friendship is abruptly brought to a halt when an accident leaves Robot stranded on a beach. 備註 Remarks: 入場守則 Admission Rules:

title: Tai Po Kau Night Adventure
summary: Join us to take a look at the amazing nocturnal fauna in Tai Po Kau!
venue: Tai Po Kau Nature Reserve, Tai Po Kau, Tai Po, NT, Hong Kong, Tai Po, NT
description: Established in 1977, Tai Po Kau Nature Reserve is a land of 460 hectares, containing some of Hong Kong’s most mature secondary forests along with many of Hong Kong’s fauna. Nowadays, it has easily become one of the most popular and well-known wildlife spots, providing a safe haven for a plethora of wildlife species, such as migratory birds and Hong Kong warty newts during the winter months, as well as frogs and many different types of arthropods in the summer months. Regular sightings include Red Muntjac, a small and only member of the deer family in Hong Kong, along with East Asian Porcupines and Wild Boars, while certain amount of luck is required to encounter the elusive Leopard Cat. On this night tour, we will explore the lowest levels of this huge nature reserve, where we may see frogs near the ponds and rivers, moths fluttering about, insects resting on the plantation, and maybe even bats flying through the night sky. Tai Po Kau is also a well known location to see Fireflies, which breed from March to November, with breeding peaking between May to August. Dwarf Wood Scorpians are also common at Tai Po Kau, with the aid of UV lights we will be able to see these shy nocturnal creatures at their best, as their exoskeleten glows a bright cyan-green under UV lights. Join us as we explore the nocturnal fauna of Hong Kong Tour Fee: $330 for adults, $250 for children under 8 (minimum age is 3 years old) Meeting location: Tai Po Kau Nature reserve entrance (To get there by public transport, go to Tai Po Market MTR Exit A, take mini-bus 28k and ask to be dropped off at the "Tsung Tsai Yuen" bus station) Walking Distance: 5km Walk grade: Easy to moderate Terrain: Paved and nature paths, some steps Facilities: Toilets along route What to bring: Night torch or headlamps, bottle with drinking water, mosquito repellent Refund Policy • For a full refund, cancel at least 24 hours in advance of the start date of the experience. • The event will be fully refunded if tour is canceled due to yellow/red/black rain or thunderstorm warning .

title: The Spirit of Gascony - Armagnac Tasting Journey| Myicellar 雲窖
summary: 帶大家細味嘉斯科尼的靈魂，探索雅文邑的百年風華！
venue: MyiCellar Showroom 907, MyiCellar Showroom 907 20 Westlands Road, Quarry Bay, HKI, Hong Kong, Quarry Bay, HKI
description: 一杯雅文邑，一段法式旅程。有別於干邑輕盈圓潤, 柔和的口感；雅文邑是屬於口感和風味都更加豐富濃厚的白蘭地，帶有乾果和焦糖等香氣，酒體飽滿，使用十種不同的葡萄品種釀製。雅文邑一般以單一酒莊產酒為主，相對少收購及取材自葡萄農場，產量較為罕有；每個酒莊都有自己的釀造風格，使得雅文邑的個性更加鮮明，也更具獨特性和收藏價值。今次「主打」五款Fotan Vintage 系列，囊括1995至2000年酒款，帶大家細味嘉斯科尼的靈魂，探索雅文邑的百年風華！

description: The Wanch Jazz Series: Johnny & The JazzBird – Vintage Jazz Romance Step into an evening of pure jazz elegance at The Wanch! On Wednesday, 30th July, let Johnny Lau & The JazzBird transport you to the golden age of crooners and candlelit clubs. Johnny Lau is no ordinary frontman—he’s a Hong Kong music legend with a rich baritone and magnetic stage presence, equally at home crooning Nat King Cole or firing up the room with a touch of rockabilly flair. Backed by The JazzBird, Johnny brings new life to the greatest hits of the 30s to 50s, including classics such as “What a Difference a Day Made” and “Cry Me a River.” Expect a setlist that’s all about mood and nostalgia. Whether you’re a jazz aficionado or just looking for a night of smooth vocals and vintage charm, this is an experience you’ll remember. Let Johnny and The JazzBird’s artistry sweep you away. Book your tickets now! Event Details: Wednesday, 30th July 2025 9:00 PM - 10:15 PM The Wanch, 1/F, Henan Building, 90 Jaffe Road, Wan Chai Tickets: HK$300 Walk-in Tickets: HK$350 (all tickets include one complimentary drink and HK$100 food & drink voucher) The Wanch 爵士系列：Johnny & The JazzBird – 復古爵士浪漫夜 來The Wanch 感受一晚優雅的爵士優雅氛吧！7月30號（星期三），Johnny Lau & The JazzBird 會帶你穿越時空，帶你們回去那個音樂的黃金年代。 Johnny Lau 不只是一個歌手，他簡直是香港樂壇傳奇，低沉磁性嗓音加上超強台風，無論唱 Nat King Cole 嘅經典 ballad，還是節奏強勁的rockabilly，君魅力四射。今次再度與The JazzBird 合作，Johnny 會為你重新演繹三、五十年代嘅經典名曲，例如《What a Difference a Day Made》和《Cry Me a River》，setlist 滿載情懷及氣氛。 無論你是否爵士迷，還是想一晚享受巨磁性的歌聲同復古情調，這個晚上一定令你難忘。就讓Johnny 同 The JazzBird 嘅音樂魅力帶你飛一轉！ 活動詳情： 2025年7月30日（星期三） 晚上9點至10點15分 The Wanch（灣仔謝斐道90號河南大廈1樓） 預售飛：HK$300 即場飛：HK$350（包括一杯飲品及HK$100餐飲券）

title: Timfernal Affairs ft Tim Chan, Tim To, Tim Lam, and more!
summary: A special stand-up comedy showcase featuring Tim Chan, Tim To, Tim Lam, Caro Chan, Ha Chu, and Chris Musni!
venue: The Aftermath, 57-59 Wyndham Street, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Tim Chan is the main performer in stand up comedy group “Hall of Laughs." Tim started his comedy career in 2011, winning the 2011 Hong Kong International Comedy Competition and has since sold out dozens of shows in Hong Kong and Australia. He has also performed in Mainland China, Macau, Taiwan, Malaysia, and Singapore. Tim is not only active in Hong Kong, he also performed in Mainland, Macau, Taiwan, Malaysia, Singapore & Australia. In 2017, Tim was invited by TEDxYOUTH to be a TEDx speaker. “Tim's jokes sound like someone recalling a night out whilst it's still happening and somehow funnier” - Ashley James Tim To is a Chinese Canadian comedian, he grew up in Toronto and has spent about a decade living in Hong Kong. His comedic style explores his unhinged interpretation of his experiences and defines his own brand of logic. In 2020, he was the winner of BushiRoast 4 and continues to explore his comedic style in shows throughout Hong Kong. Tim Lam is American Chinese and grew up in Singapore. Having originally worked in finance, he ended up in culinary school for a year, thus becoming the most disappointing Chinese first born son ever. He also showers regularly and lives with a cat. Caro Chan is a dynamic half-Chinese, half-African comedian based in Hong Kong, known for her unique perspective and vibrant stage presence. With a playful charm and a smile that lights up the room, Caro brings a wealth of storytelling and performance skills to her comedy. She made her stand-up debut in September 2023, quickly captivating audiences with her sharp wit and relatable humor. Caro's performances often explore themes of cultural identity and the nuances of life in a diverse city, making her a fresh voice in the Hong Kong comedy scene. Ha Chu is a stand up comedian from Hong Kong. His unique comedy style has brought him to stages across Asia, Australia and Europe. He is the first comedian from Asia to perform at the Christiania Comedy Club (Denmark). He was chosen by Melbourne International Comedy Festival to perform at the MICF- “Comedy Zone Asia”. He is a regular at the Hong Kong International Comedy Festival as well as the past winner of the Hong Kong International Comedy Competition. “One of the most original comedians I have worked with. In my opinion, he’s a must see comedian.” - Tom Cotter (USA) Chris Musni is a San Francisco native who moved to Hong Kong to achieve his lifelong dream of fame and fortune. Failing that, he took the stage and developed a witty comedic style that forces the audience to ask themselves questions such as “Why are things the way they are?” or “When is this show going to end?” When not onstage you can find Chris’s big nose in a nonfiction book while thinking he’s better than you or he might be shooting hoops with basketballs in Tseung Kwan O. "Very good." - Tom Arnold

venue: The Yoga Lane, 27 High Street #B/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: The class will focus on holding yoga poses mindfully for 2-5 minutes to allow participants to stretch out tired muscles and find a space to relax and restore without the hustle and bustle of the city noise. This class will be complemented with sound healing to help with further relaxation. We hope to hold space for participants to embark on an inward experience to release stress and find ease in the body and the mind. Suitable for all levels, with modifications and variations offered to accommodate all participants. Bilingual instructions will also be on offer. We aim to make fitness for mental health accessible in Hong Kong. That’s why we offer places in our classes for free for those experiencing financial hardship. Each TNN Yoga class costs $705HKD, $255 is an NGO discounted rental of the space and $450 goes to our amazing instructor(s) as we believe in fair pay. If you donate, you will be ‘paying it forward’ and providing a space in our next yoga class for someone facing financial hardship. We want everyone to have access to the support they need, regardless of their identity or circumstance.Please note we will be hosting our classes at Yoga Lane STUDIO 2 unless otherwise stated.Schedule for this series: 29th May - Heinok & Valerie (sound healing) 5th June - Heinok & Mina (movement) 12th June - Heinok & Marcus (sound healing) 19th June - Heinok 26th June - Heinok & Christy (sound healing) 3rd July - Heinok & Terence (Wall rope special) 10th July - Heinok 17th July - Heinok Move Partners Taking part in physical activity can improve mental health in many ways; better sleep, happier moods, managing stress, anxiety, and intrusive thoughts, improved self-esteem, and connection to the community, to name a few. Move Partners is a collaborative project between The New Normal Charity and organisations, professionals, and athletes. We aim to reinforce the connection and the importance of moving to help support our mental health. The New Normal Charity The New Normal Charity is a Hong Kong registered S88 charity 91/19147. We offer free peer support groups for mental health. We aim to help and support one another through life's difficult moments. We want everyone to have access to the support they need, regardless of their identity or circumstance. We empower people with lived mental health experiences. We support people living in Hong Kong struggling to access the mental health support they need. Because no one should have to face mental pain alone. Heinok Heinok (she/her) is a yoga instructor, singing bowl sound healer and TNN HK volunteer. She’s a RYT-200 yoga instructor with additional training in yin yoga, making yoga accessible and singing bowl sound healing level 1. As a healthcare professional who strongly believes in equality, she is passionate about wellness and accessibility concepts. Thus, you will find her teaching with a lot of anatomical cues and modifications as she leads you through her carefully curated functional flows. Tied with her passion for mental health empowerment and advocacy, her life goal of sharing with people that ‘movement is a form of medicine’.

title: UNHEARD 2025: A2B x Mystery Train presents GNX by Kendrick Lamar

description: In this session of A2B, Eaton's ongoing vinyl- sharing series, James of Eaton Radio HK's Mystery Train podcast will lead the talk and listening session to deconstruct and demystify the themes, sounds and inspirations behind Kendrick Lamar's recent work, GNX. Talk to be held in English 在這一場 A2B 中，Eaton 的黑膠分享系列Eaton Radio HK 的《Mystery Train》播客主持人 James 將主持一場講座和聆聽環節，深入剖析和解密 Kendrick Lamar 最近的作品《GNX》中的主題、聲音和靈感。James 來自加州灣區，該處的音樂風格對專輯的聲音影響深遠，而他在嘻哈音樂中長大，加上《Mystery Train》的共同主持 Cheryl，將提供對專輯主題和發行決策的分析，以及促使其受歡迎的原因。 A2B 是 Eaton 持續進行的黑膠分享系列，邀請嘉賓深入討論在他們的音樂聆聽經驗中重要或具有開創性的作品。《Mystery Train》是 Eaton Radio HK 上由 Cheryl Chow 和 James Acey 主持的廣播節目，他們從神秘盒子中挑選歌曲，並討論音樂生活及其間的點滴。 講座將以英語進行。

title: UNHEARD 2025: BODY COUNT by Philipp Henkel
summary: BODY COUNT is a visceral and provocative exploration of the human form as both a site of trauma and resilience.
venue: Tomorrow Maybe, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road, Kowloon, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: BODY COUNT is a visceral and provocative exploration of the human form as both a site of trauma and resilience. Through a fusion of performance and mixed-media installation the piece interrogates the ways bodies are quantified, commodified, and politicized—whether in war, healthcare, or systemic violence. Drawing from inspiration: forensic anthropology, memorial archives and personal narratives, the work distorts and reconstructs the body, challenging viewers to confront the tension between individual identity and statistical anonymity. Fragmented, multiplied, or erased, the forms question: When does a body become a number? Who gets counted, and who remains invisible? With specific elements like repetitive silhouettes, raw data sonified and visualized, _Body Count_ oscillates between the intimate and the impersonal, urging a reckoning with the weight of collective loss and the fragility of corporeal existence. ________ Philipp Henkel is a German composer, curator, and multimedia artist based in Hannover. In his music, gestural instability and extended expressionism transform the subjective listening experience. His compositions and multimedia works explore the implications of technology and societal failure(s) through a research-led approach. In 2018 Henkel founded neuMERZ an interdisciplinary studio for research led art projects and curation in which he remains the artistic lead. Recent concerts and exhibitions of his work have taken place at GAIDA Festival in Lithuania, 21st Century Art Museum Kanazawa, Ryoguku Monten Hall Tokyo, Monopol Berlin, ZKM Karlsruhe.

venue: Kino, Eaton House (Co-working), 380 Nathan Road 1/F, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: At this artist talk, Christiaan will be sharing stories and sounds from the 20 year evolution of the Buddha Machine. Exploring the machine as “album,” art object and mass produced sound art device. He will offer insights and ideas on how independent artists can move beyond traditional concepts of how to release music and will share a short ambient mix using sounds from the Buddha Machine as well as other artists who have remixed Buddha Machine loops in their own works. 在這次藝術家講座中，Christiaan將分享來自佛唱機於過去20年間演變的故事和聲音。他將探討將機器視為「專輯」、藝術物件和大規模生產的聲音藝術裝置的概念。他將分享對於獨立藝術家如何超越傳統音樂發行概念的見解及想法，並分享一小段使用佛唱機聲音進行的氛圍混音，以及其他藝術家在其作品中重新混音佛唱機的音效。

title: UNHEARD 2025: Channelling Reduction by Simon Whetham
summary: “Channelling” is a kinetic audiovisual project by Simon Whetham
venue: Tomorrow Maybe, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road, Kowloon, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: “Channelling” is a kinetic audiovisual project, in which a collection of motor devices salvaged from obsolete and discarded consumer technology is reanimated by environmental sound recordings. In turn, this produces new sounds from the devices, which are amplifed using various microphones and techniques. The recordings feature seemingly mundane sound phenomena that occur unpredictably and irregularly in everyday life – passing traffic, wind, doors closing – and also sounds of other machines malfunctioning. Because of this, the movement of the devices is random, variable, and autonomous. This means the relationship between performer and devices is a collaboration rather than a master and servant type situation. “Channelling Reduction” follows the trend of technology to miniaturise as it evolves, becoming smaller and lighter, but more powerful. Simon Whetham: Since 2005 Simon Whetham has worked with sonic activity as a material. He often uses environmental sound, employing a variety of methods and techniques in order to obtain often unnoticed and obscured sonic phenomena. He also explores ways of creating physical traces of sound and transforming energy forms. Whetham performs and exhibits internationally, has received a large number of commissions and awards, has many published composed works and regularly collaborates with other artists. His practice also covers giving active listening, field recording and technology repurposing workshops.

title: UNHEARD 2025: Into the Vapor: a foray into an Internet Electronic Genre
summary: A journey through the first decade of vaporwave (an acousmatic, sampling-based genre of internet music) 介紹vaporwave（基於聲音和取樣的網路音樂類型）及其衍生的頭十年。
venue: Terrible Baby, Music Room, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: A brief journey through the first decade of vaporwave (an acousmatic, sampling-based genre of internet music) - and its offshoots - in the form of a playlist with artist's favourite selections. Angus Lee (b. 1992) is a Hongkong-born performer-composer who has appeared in international music festivals across North America, Asia, continental Europe and the UK. He has been a musician of the Hong Kong New Ensemble since 2016, and has been a full time faculty member of The University of Hong Kong's Music Department since 2022. His current doctoral research combines his creative compositional work with an investigation of the internet music genre, _vaporwave_. In his (almost non-existent) spare time outside of practising, rehearsing, performing, composing and teaching, he is an avid reader of philosophy and political theory, and enjoys swimming, hiking and playing badminton. Talk will be Bi- lingual (Cantonese & English) 對於蒸汽波（這是一種基於聲音和取樣的網路音樂類型）及其衍生形式的第一個十年的簡要旅程，以藝術家的最愛選曲的播放列表形式呈現。 Angus Lee（1992年生）是一位出生於香港的表演者和作曲家，曾參加北美、亞洲、大陸歐洲和英國的國際音樂節。自2016年以來，他一直是香港新音樂團的音樂家，並自2022年起成為香港大學音樂系的全職教員。他目前的博士研究結合了他的創作作曲工作與對網路音樂類型蒸汽波的探討。在他幾乎不存在的空閒時間裡，他熱衷於閱讀哲學和政治理論，並喜歡游泳、健行和打羽毛球。 講座將以雙語（廣東話和英語）進行。

summary: The Sonic Officer is an art project initiated and curated by Liz Wong, co-curated by Andio Lai. 一項由 Liz Wong 發起和策劃的藝術項目，並由 Andio Lai 共同策劃。

Liz (@2izia) Andio (@andiosound) Tsun Yeung (@tsunwinston) Pazu (@paaaazu_ ) Ken (@kenwkl_ ) __________________________ The Sonic Officer is an art project initiated and curated by Liz Wong, co-curated by Andio Lai that will turn our music room into an office performance space where the audience are invited to experience desktop windows, codes of audiovisuals, bugs debugging, live sampling and experimental sound. Sonic Officer是一個由 Liz Wong 發起和策劃、Andio Lai 共同策劃的藝術項目，將我們的音樂室轉變為一個「辦公空間」，邀請觀眾體驗桌面視窗、視聽代碼、錯誤除錯、現場取樣和實驗聲音。該項目以計算視聽和實驗聲音的藝術形式為基礎，結合各種媒體藝術實踐，如現場編碼、設備藝術和基於螢幕的編程。

venue: Terrible Baby, Music Room, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: All the times I couldn’t say goodbye… is a deeply personal performance project by Roberto Maqueda that transforms unspoken farewells into sound. It explores the emotional landscape of relationships that faded without closure—those moments suspended in silence and unresolved endings. Through four original compositions, the work navigates cycles of memory, doubt, and longing, while ultimately offering a fragile sense of hope. Premiered in Zürich in 2025, the piece is an attempt to sonify the unsaid and give voice to what was left behind.

title: UNHEARD 2025: Searching Out, Saving, and Sounding Spaces
summary: This presentation introduces research into the spaces for sound art & experimental music as developed in the Chinese Mainland & HK.
venue: Terrible Baby, Music Room, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: This presentation will introduce Edward Sanderson's research into the spaces for sound art and experimental music as they have developed in the Chinese Mainland and Hong Kong, and describe some of my recent activities based on this research. For the last 15 years or so he has focused on spaces for sound art and experimental music and spatially-related practices that find their homes in these spaces. Geographically, he restricts himself to the Chinese Mainland and Hong Kong (already a huge area), and the period is from the late 1990s to the present day, although he also deals with some earlier material for context. This research has led him to build up a physical archive of material, currently based in Hong Kong, and from this I have produced various texts, events, and curated exhibitions. This talk will be structured around four important stages in the development of this research: His PhD at HK Baptist University's Academy of Visual Art; the 2023 “Sounds Like Print” display at Tai Kwun Contemporary; the recently concluded exhibition “It Always Sounds Somewhere” at the Inside-Out Art Museum in Beijing; and the performance series “Exit-Entry” which invites Mainland artists to perform alongside local artists, and which serves as a further means to promote connections and knowledge sharing between the Chinese Mainland and Hong Kong. _______________ Bio: Dr. Edward Sanderson is a researcher and curator focusing on contemporary non-mainstream sonic practices from the Chinese Mainland and Hong Kong. In 2025 Edward curated the exhibition "It Always Sounds Somewhere" at Inside-Out Art Museum in Beijing, presenting an extensive set of installations of the multiple forms of space used for sound art and experimental music, supplemented by a series of related performances and talks. Edward is currently developing a physical and online archive of sound-related material, and co-curating the Exit-Entry performance series bringing together Chinese Mainland and local artists to play in Hong Kong’s underground venues. Talk to be held in English 這場演講將介紹 Edward Sanderson 對中國大陸和香港聲音藝術及實驗音樂空間的研究，並描述他基於這項研究所進行的一些近期活動。 在過去的15年左右，他專注於聲音藝術和實驗音樂的空間，以及在這些空間中發展的與空間相關的實踐。他的研究地理範圍限於中國大陸和香港（已經是一個相當龐大的區域），研究時間從1990年代末到現在，同時他也會涉及一些早期的材料以提供背景。這項研究使他建立了一個實體檔案庫，目前位於香港，並由此產生了各種文本、活動和策展展覽。 這場演講將圍繞這項研究發展的四個重要階段進行：他在香港浸會大學視覺藝術學院的博士學位；2023年在大館當代藝術中心的“Sounds Like Print”展覽；最近結束的北京 Inside-Out 藝術博物館的展覽“它總是在某處響起”；以及“Exit-Entry”表演系列，邀請大陸藝術家與本地藝術家共同表演，進一步促進中國大陸與香港之間的聯繫和知識分享。 _______________ 簡介：Edward Sanderson 博士是一位研究者和策展人，專注於來自中國大陸和香港的當代非主流聲音實踐。在2025年，Edward 在北京 Inside-Out 藝術博物館策劃了展覽“它總是在某處響起”，展示了多種用於聲音藝術和實驗音樂的空間形式的安裝作品，並輔以一系列相關的表演和講座。Edward 正在開發一個與聲音相關的實體和在線檔案庫，並共同策劃 Exit-Entry 表演系列，將中國大陸藝術家和本地藝術家聚集在香港的地下場地演出。 講座將以英語進行。

title: UNHEARD 2025: Shared Frequencies: How to build community through radio
summary: A panel discussion w/ an assemble of community radios from Asia & Europe discussing the enduring medium of radio and how it builds community
venue: Kino, Eaton House (Co-working), 380 Nathan Road 1/F, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: A panel discussion with an assemble of community radios from Asia & Europe discussing the enduring medium of radio and the myriad ways in which it builds community. w/ Arthur Bray from FM Belowground (Hong Kong) Chris from Res Radio (Vienna) Dana from The Nifty Radio(Jakarta) James from Eaton Radio (Hong Kong) ___________________ FM Belowground: FM Belowground is a community radio station located in the basement of Landmark Building with a varied programme ranging from local dance and indie bands to podcasts to DJing workshops connecting people from different backgrounds and creative practices. Res Radio: Res.Radio is a non-commercial community webradio based in Vienna to strengthen and display subcultural genres. From its founding in 2019, the radio grew into a multicultural community/platform featuring artists with many different backgrounds. Within this platform people connect, exchange ideas and create content around music across all genres and talks, which addresses topics like contemporary culture, social injustice and other phenomena. Res.Radio is a space of diverse artistic freedom and is made from people for people. ___________________ The Nifty Radio: The Nifty Radio (Nifty) is an alternative music radio and archiving platform community-based in Bogor, notably in the electronic music scene. Providing a place for DJs, musicians, and music geeks from all over the world to promote, distribute, and create new connections, in line with the growth of the music ecosystem surrounds them. Presenting various types of music, and the sub-genres in it, also come with the artistic and visuals that represent the circumstances of the city. @mortarwithpestle / @theniftyradio ____________________ Eaton Radio: Eaton Radio empowers grassroots storytelling and supports emerging, contemporary, and historic underground music. We’ve produced over 2000+ shows of talk radio and music through a rich and varied rotation of DJ mixes, interviews, and regular shows.

title: UNHEARD 2025: Singing Bowl Session - Tuning the Mind, Healing the Body
summary: Shoji presents a singing bowl session for dogs and their owners. Shoji 為狗狗及其主人呈現一場頌缽音療約會。
venue: Kino, Eaton House (Co-working), 380 Nathan Road 1/F, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: Reserve spot at the following link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd6Eac724J0yIOOs2qRryfTorMGgEFB95eMNlVCGWdpC-cMSg/viewform?usp=header Ticket price: HKD$480 for 1 ppl + 1 pet (to be paid on arrival) _______________________________ Shoji presents a singing bowl session for dogs and their owners on 27/7 Singing bowl sound healing is a therapeutic practice that utilizes the resonant tones and vibrations produced by singing bowls—often made of metal or crystal. These bowls are played by striking or rubbing the rim with a mallet, creating harmonic sounds that promote relaxation and mindfulness. The sound waves produced can help to balance energy, reduce stress, and facilitate a meditative state. This ancient practice is rooted in various spiritual traditions and is gaining popularity in modern wellness for its ability to enhance emotional and physical well-being. - Calming Effect: The soothing tones of singing bowls can create a calming environment that helps reduce anxiety for both dogs and their owners, making it a perfect tool for relaxation. - Bonding Experience: Participating in sound healing sessions together can strengthen the bond between dogs and their owners, promoting feelings of safety and trust. - Stress Relief: Just as humans experience stress, pets can also feel anxious. The gentle sounds can help alleviate stress in dogs, making them more relaxed and at ease. - Enhanced Well-Being: Sound healing can promote physical and emotional well-being for both dogs and their masters, contributing to a healthier lifestyle and better quality of life. - Positive Environment: The vibrations and sounds can create a positive atmosphere that encourages playfulness and joy, benefiting the overall mood of the household. Overall, sound healing fosters a peaceful space that nurtures the connection between humans and their canine companions. 在以下鏈接預約位置： https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd6Eac724J0yIOOs2qRryfTorMGgEFB95eMNlVCGWdpC-cMSg/viewform?usp=header票價：HKD$480，包含1人 + 1隻寵物（到達時支付） _______________________________ Shoji 將於 7 月 27 日為狗狗及其主人呈現一場頌缽音療約會。頌缽音療是一種治療性實踐，利用頌缽產生的共鳴音調和振動，這些頌缽通常由金屬或水晶製成。頌缽通過用槌子敲擊或摩擦邊緣來演奏，產生和諧的聲音，促進放鬆和正念。所產生的聲波可以幫助平衡能量、減少壓力並促進冥想狀態。這種古老的實踐根植於各種靈性傳統中，並因其增強情感和身體健康的能力而在現代健康領域中越來越受歡迎。 總括而言，音療促進了一個和平的空間，培養人類與其犬類伴侶之間的聯繫。

title: Virtual Reality: Versailles, Lost Gardens of the Sun King
summary: An immersive 25-minute virtual reality experience where you explore 3 magical and long-lost gardens from 1682, brought back to life with VR✨
venue: 22 Museum Drive,West Kowloon Cultural District, 22 Museum Drive Units GF-01/02/03, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: ABOUT THE STORY Step into 17th-Century Versailles – Through Virtual Reality Experience the forgotten heart of Versailles, where gardens once staged the grandeur of a rising empire. In this one-of-a-kind VR journey, guided by the legendary landscape architect André Le Nôtre, you’ll rediscover spaces imagined by Louis XIV as the pinnacle of royal art, power, and entertainment. 🦁 The Royal Menagerie – One of Europe’s earliest zoos, filled with exotic animals gifted by foreign rulers. It once symbolized royal power and global reach. 🌀 The Labyrinth Grove – A fantastical garden built for the king’s son, filled with fountains and sculptures representing Aesop’s fables.🏛️ The Grotto of Tethys – A breathtaking palace of water and light, once a symbol of royal power and artistic innovation. These gardens were designed as a living theatre — an artistic and political stage to dazzle the court and reflect the king’s absolute power. Today, they are reborn through immersive technology.

title: Women Changemakers Gathering in HK: Sound Healing & Creative Writing
summary: A gathering for women changemakers to rejuvenate creativity
venue: Dream Impact, Unit C, 4/F, 760 Cheung Sha Wan Road, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: A safe place for women changemakers (and aspiring women changemakers) to meet one another; A small-scale gathering where you can actually have intentional conversations with everyone; A community you show up and participate equally as an agent of change; A space to exchange stories and find inspirations to bring collective impact; A tribe you can come back to as your support network and build intergenerational friendships. This is what this gathering is about. For women changemakers. On August 10 Sunday afternoon, Carmen Chan of Girls Be Change and Dorothy Lam of Dream Impact are going to team up with published writer Gillian Del Mundo and certified sound meditation healer Carol Lee, to have this special community gathering to connect changemaking, creative writing, and sound healing together. Let's explore our inner creativity and voice to lead change from within. It is a gathering where everyone shows up as an equal participant, questioning and chatting. No panel. No presentation. No speech. Just intentional conversations. Come join us on Aug 10 (Sun) for an afternoon to meet other fellow women changemakers and explore your creativity via soundhealing and writing! What is Women Changemakers Community Series? The idea began in the summer of 2023 when two changemakers in Hong Kong, Carmen (Girls Be Change) and Dorothy (Dream Impact), questioned and envisioned what an ideal community is. We need a safe place among women changemakers to have organic meetups, intentional conversations and idea exchange with social ease, find inspirations and encouragement from each other, and build authentic friendships and support networks. The first Women Changemakers Community Gathering was held in Hong Kong on March 8, 2024 at International Women’s Day. Ever since then, Girls Be Change cohosted with 20 (and counting) organizations and gathered over 150 (and counting) women changemakers in Hong Kong, Indonesia, Kenya, and Tanzania. With 15+ gatherings around the globe, a vibrant community of global women changemakers was formed and connected virtually to raise questions, exchange ideas, and celebrate wins. ​Co-organizers:

title: World Cafe: Gaining Courage
summary: Join us for this World Café-style discussion, where changemakers can reflect, share how we sustain our impact, and get inspiration
venue: Dream Impact 夢創成真, Unit C, 4/F, 760 Cheung Sha Wan Road,, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: Meaningful change starts with courage — the courage to face our fears, challenge our limiting beliefs, and take bold steps toward creating the impact we envision. It’s about moving beyond hesitation and stepping into action with confidence and clarity. Join us for the final session of the World Café: Journey of Change series, Gaining Courage, where we’ll explore how to identify the beliefs that hold us back, build resilience, and take transformative steps toward meaningful action. Whether you’re a changemaker in your community, organization, or beyond, this is your last opportunity in this series to reflect, share insights, and co-create bold strategies to turn your vision into reality. 📍 World Café is an interactive dialogue format where participants rotate between small-group conversations, then gather insights together. It’s designed for shared learning, deeper connection, and collective clarity. 我們如何勇敢推動有意義的改變？ 有意義的改變始於勇氣——勇氣讓我們面對恐懼、挑戰自己的限制性信念，並大膽邁出實現願景的第一步。這是一種超越猶豫，帶著自信與清晰行動的力量。 加入我們的 世界咖啡館：改變之旅 系列最終場，《世界咖啡館：勇氣之試鍊》，一起探索如何識別限制我們的信念，培養韌性，並採取能帶來轉型行動的具體步驟。無論您是在社區、組織，或其他領域推動改變，這是本系列中最後一次機會，讓您反思、分享見解，並共同創建大膽的策略，將您的願景化為現實。 📍 世界咖啡館是一種互動式對話形式，透過小組輪流討論及集體收穫，加深彼此連結，共同學習，凝聚智慧。按此了解更多有關世界咖啡館的資訊。 World Cafe is a discussion format driven by intentionally crafted questions, designed for 12 or more people to Think Together. 🌎☕️ ​In the process, participants are divided into small groups to discuss a question, and then join a new group to discuss the next one. After that, everyone comes together to share what they learned. We'll be able to take home the main ideas, themes, and insights that emerged from the discussions. Click here to learn more about World Cafe. 公眾 Public admission: HK$180夢創會員 Dream Impact members: HK$150 *Price inclusive of sandwiches and drinks*票價包括三文治及飲品 Language : English as primary language. Depends on the participants, we may use Cantonese for discussion as well語言：英文為主要媒介。視乎參加者，我們可以用廣東話進行討論

title: World Cafe: Systemic Change
summary: Join us for this World Café-style discussion, where changemakers can reflect, share how we sustain our impact, and get inspiration
venue: Dream Impact 夢創成真, Unit C, 4/F, 760 Cheung Sha Wan Road,, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: How can we position ourselves to drive systemic change? Creating meaningful impact requires more than passion — it starts with understanding our place within the system, the relationships and interactions within it, and making strategic moves that create ripple effects. Join us for the next World Café: Systemic Change session, where we’ll explore how to map our role in complex systems, identify key relationships, and design actions that lead to lasting impact. Whether you’re in policy, advocacy, or social innovation, this is your chance to reflect, share insights, and co-create strategies to amplify your work's transformative potential. 📍 World Café is an interactive dialogue format where participants rotate between small-group conversations, then gather insights together. It’s designed for shared learning, deeper connection, and collective clarity. 我們如何定位自己以推動系統性變革？ 創造有意義的影響不僅僅需要熱情——它始於了解我們在系統中的位置、系統內的關係和互動，並採取能夠產生連鎖效應的策略行動。 加入我們的下一場 《世界咖啡館：系統性變革》 ，一起探索如何繪製自己在複雜系統中的角色、識別關鍵關係，並設計能帶來持久影響的行動。不論您從事的是政策、倡導還是社會創新，這都是一次反思、分享見解並共同創建策略的絕佳機會，助您加倍工作帶來的潛在影響。 📍 世界咖啡館是一種互動式對話形式，透過小組輪流討論及集體收穫，加深彼此連結，共同學習，凝聚智慧。按此了解更多有關世界咖啡館的資訊。 World Cafe is a discussion format driven by intentionally crafted questions, designed for 12 or more people to Think Together. 🌎☕️ ​In the process, participants are divided into small groups to discuss a question, and then join a new group to discuss the next one. After that, everyone comes together to share what they learned. We'll be able to take home the main ideas, themes, and insights that emerged from the discussions. title: 「認識自己．規劃未來」人類圖 x 生涯發展的實踐探索 | 生涯123探索工作坊
summary: 你可能正站在人生十字路口、或在工作中感到不被理解、不被善用。本工作坊透過人類圖系統，協助你更深入了解自己的角色定位與決策模式，從而作出更貼近自我的生涯選擇與規劃。
venue: The 80|20 9樓905室, 九龍觀塘偉業街161號, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: 🎯 「掌握內在天賦，打造職場優勢！」 我真正適合的工作，是什麼模樣？ 我究竟有甚麼的潛能及天賦？ 最適合我的工作環境究竟是甚麼? 在職場上，你是否常感到以上困惑? 其實，每個人都有專屬的生涯或職場優勢，只是你還未完全掌握！透過 人類圖 (Human Design)，你將能清楚了解自己的角色定位和決策方式，最大化你的潛力，每一個人都值得一份與自己特質匹配的職涯選擇。 🔍 什麼是人類圖？ 人類圖系統是每個人獨一無二的天生說明書，幫助了解自己的天賦、優勢及容易受影響的地方。 🎨 人類圖能如何幫助我？ 透過解讀角色類型，學習如何有效地做出符合自己的決策，減少內耗。更能讓你了解如何運用自己穩定的能量與潛力，在生活、職場中找到更多可能性並真正活出自我。 👣 人類圖能如何提升工作表現？ 🌟 角色定位：了解自己在團隊中的最佳角色，適合引領還是執行 🌟 決策模式：學習如何做出與自己特質一致的決策，減少職場迷茫和內耗 🌟 團隊協作：掌握與不同類型同事協作的方法，提升工作效率和人際關係 完成工作坊，你將能 ✅ 更自信地發揮自己的專業能力，成為團隊中不可或缺的一員 ✅ 減少不必要的職場內耗，提升工作滿意度 ✅ 在職場決策中更果斷，減少迷茫與壓力 📌 名額有限，搶先體驗！

title: 唐閣 x 珍酒晚宴 | MyiCellar 雲窖
summary: 蟬聯米芝蓮三星多年的粵菜食府
venue: 唐閣, 香港朗廷酒店1樓及2樓 北京道8號, 尖沙咀, KOW, Hong Kong, 尖沙咀, KOW
description: 活動介紹 Event information | 位於香港朗廷酒店的粵菜食府唐閣，一直堅持選用最新鮮及上乘的食材入饌，匠心製作出頂級粵菜佳餚。餐廳裝潢以金色為主，配以上好的絲綢、古典的螺旋樓梯及牆壁上的現代雕刻，一顯唐代古典優雅的氣息。開業三十餘年，蟬聯米芝蓮三星多年，實力可見一斑。 搭配中國醬香型白酒主要品牌、四大國宴用酒之一的貴州珍酒，其悠長的醬香讓味覺體驗更加豐富，更有融入珍酒烹調的招牌菜式XO醬爆炒乳龍蝦，在格調高雅的環境中，讓您能細意品嚐一場難忘的粵菜美酒體驗。 T’ang Court, the esteemed Cantonese restaurant at The Langham, Hong Kong, has always adhered to the philosophy of using only the freshest and finest ingredients to craft exceptional Cantonese cuisine. The restaurant’s opulent gold-toned interiors, adorned with luxurious silks, a grand spiral staircase, and contemporary wall carvings, evoke the classical elegance of the Tang Dynasty. For over three decades, T’ang Court has consistently held the prestigious Michelin three-star rating—a testament to its culinary excellence. Paired with Zhenjiu, one of China’s premier sauce-aroma baijiu brands and a staple of national banquets, the liquor’s lingering, complex aroma elevates the dining experience. Signature dishes like Stir-Fried Baby Lobster in XO Sauce, infused with Zhenjiu, further showcase this harmony. In an ambiance of refined grandeur, guests are invited to savor an unforgettable symphony of Cantonese flavors and premium baijiu.

title: 鴨巴甸公館 x 珍酒晚宴 | MyiCellar 雲窖
summary: 在優雅的氛圍中感受藝術與美食的融合!
venue: 鴨巴甸公館, 蘭桂坊酒店1樓 九如坊3號, 中環, HKI, Hong Kong, 中環, HKI
description: 活動介紹 Event information | 鴨巴甸公館私廚團隊秉承【美味求真】的宗旨，以經典粵菜為藍本，再注入不同菜系的特色，取食材之鮮發揮極致，力臻演繹出一系列珍饈美饌。 餐廳概念源自原有地址街道命名，得予多位古董美術收藏家的支持，餐廳內展出多件美侖美奐的藝術精品，濃厚的文化情懷充滿每個角落，除了味蕾享受，也能滿足視覺享受。 精緻美味的菜式搭配香氣濃郁、回味綿長的高端醬香型白酒【貴州珍酒】，更有珍酒入饌的特別海鮮菜式，在優雅的氛圍中一起感受藝術與美食的融合吧！ Upholding the ethos of "Culinary Excellence," Aap Ba Din reinterprets classic Cantonese cuisine with cross-cultural inspirations. Inspired by its historic street name and supported by art collectors, the restaurant showcases stunning antiques, blending gourmet dining with visual artistry. Savor the signature dishes paired with aromatic Kweichow Zhenjiu, premium sauce-aroma baijiu and a staple of national banquets. Join us for an elegant fusion of art and gastronomy!

title: 如 x 中國佳釀晚宴 | MyiCellar 雲窖
summary: 帶您體驗粵式美饌與中國佳釀的魅力。
venue: 如, 荃灣西如心酒店7樓 楊屋道8號, 荃灣, HKI, Hong Kong, 荃灣, HKI
description: 活動介紹 Event information | 「如」以傳統中菜精髓糅合時尚優雅，堅持使用本地上乘食材及正宗烹調手法，演繹出一系列備受喜愛的時令滋味，並致力實踐可持續發展的飲食概念及傳承中菜的深厚文化。 在這場匠心獨運的晚宴中，我們特別呈獻國宴級醬香型白酒「貴州珍酒」及源自雲南海拔2600米純淨高原的「香格里拉葡萄酒」。10道精緻美饌與6款佳釀相互輝映，讓您體驗粵式美饌與中國佳釀的魅力。 RÚ celebrates authentic Chinese culinary arts in tasteful modern elegance. Reimagined by our master chefs, classic Cantonese specialities are turned into award-winning dishes with vibrant seasonal flavours. With a commitment to sustainability, ingredients are sourced locally and prepared authentically as an ode to the preservation of our environment and culture. At this exquisitely crafted dinner, we are proud to present Kweichow Zhenjiu, a national-banquet-grade sauce-aroma baijiu, and Shangri-La Wines, sourced from Yunnan plateau at an elevation of 2,600 meters. Ten exquisite dishes and six fine wines will complement each other, allowing you to experience the charm of Cantonese delicacies paired with China’s finest beverages.

title: 【頌缽x瑜伽深度療癒｜覺醒身體的智慧】
summary: ▫️Grace老師引導流動瑜珈喚醒覺知 ▫️Nickie老師教學頌缽操作原理與技巧 ▫️雙人實作：陰瑜珈伸展+頌缽深度放鬆 ✨適合： • 頌缽初學者（手把手教） • 久坐僵硬需放鬆者 • 想體驗聲波療癒效果
venue: 香港執業催眠師中心, 4-5號 諾士佛臺 13樓03室, HK, KOW, Hong Kong, HK, KOW
description: 🌟 【頌缽x瑜伽深度療癒｜覺醒身體的智慧】「在聲頻與瑜伽的交織中，找回身心最舒適的節奏」 🧘‍♀️🌿 工作坊亮點: 雙導師帶領 ▎第一階段：流動覺醒在 Nickie老師的沉穩頌缽聲頻 引導下，由 Grace老師 帶領：✅ 瑜伽式子 – 喚醒身體覺知 × 意識呼吸✅ 覺知建立 – 專注當下，掃描身體訊號(關節甦醒)✅ 思緒整理 – 釋放腦中雜音，進入深度放鬆 ▎第二階段：頌缽基礎教學（Nickie老師指導）✓ 頌缽操作原理(零基礎也能學懂)✓ 正確托缽敲缽基本手法演練✓ 安全注意事項 ▎第三階段(最重點階段)：深度共振轉換至 陰瑜珈深層伸展，雙人互動療癒：🔹 Partner頌缽體驗 – 輪流在彼此關鍵部位施作🔹 精準頻率應用 – 針對緊繃區調整敲缽速度與壓力🔹 肌肉聲波鬆解 – 震動直達筋膜層，疼痛及壓力迅速緩解 🎯 這堂課適合：▪️ 長期久坐僵硬的「辦公桌戰士」▪️ 渴望「聲音+體位法」雙重放鬆的探索者▪️ 思緒停不下來，連睡覺都在想待辦事項▪️ 即使頌缽初學者也能輕易上手 【頌缽x瑜伽深度療癒｜覺醒身體的智慧】📅 日期：7月29日(二)⏰ 時間：7:30-9:30pm📍 地點：尖沙咀諾士佛臺4-5號東港商業大廈13樓03室收費：$199* 需自備瑜伽墊 💡 為什麼這組合超有效？1️⃣ 瑜珈拉伸增加肌肉血流量 → 頌缽振動傳導提升療癒效率2️⃣ 陰瑜珈長時間停留 → 讓聲波有足夠時間鬆解筋膜黏連3️⃣ 聲波震盪清理能量阻塞，讓體式效果加倍 👩‍🏫 導師團隊介紹▎Nickie So｜SINGING BOWL HK 創辦人▫️美國NGH催眠治療導師▫️能量頌缽療癒導師▫️融合科學與靈性，擅長將複雜技法簡化教學 ▎Grace Tang｜印度傳統瑜珈導師▫️印度官方認證200小時瑜珈導師（RYT）▫️YACEP權認證陰陽流動/經絡瑜珈/輪瑜珈專家▫️能量頌缽療癒師80小時深度培訓（含「頌缽科學」認證）▫️正念減壓8週系統訓練（MBSR） 【查詢及報名】 WhatsApp: 63821806 (或Signal) 可按 https://wa.me/85263821806 FB: facebook.com/singingbowlhongkong IG: instagram.com/singingbowlhongkong

title: Xavier Vignon Wine Tasting
summary: Join us for a fun evening of tasting exquisite Xavier Vignon wines!

description: Xavier Vignon Wine Tasting Join us for an exclusive evening dedicated to the exceptional wines of Xavier Vignon at Premier Cru. Experience a curated selection of five exquisite wines, personally presented by the knowledgeable representative. Mark your calendars and prepare for a delightful evening of good wine and great company!

title: Yoga Class with Karen Chiang
summary: All are welcome to join our curated lineup of poolside yoga sessions. Whether you're looking to energise, deepen, or strengthen.
venue: 21/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road Kowloon, Hong Kong, KOW 00000, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: Begin your Saturday with intention through a carefully crafted journey of movement and breath. These sessions have been thoughtfully curated by instructor Karen Chiang — from a more gentle session in the early morning, to a more energising and invigorating flow session, to a more focused and strength building session that combines yoga and pilates - there is something for all! 8:30 - 9:30am | MORNING FLOW Gently awaken your body and mind with our poolside Morning Flow--a nurturing Hatha yoga session perfect for beginners. This class invites you to restore balance through mindful, guided poses and breath awareness, helping you cultivate calm and clarity to carry with you throughout your day. 10:00 - 11:00am | INVIGORATING FLOW Energise your Saturday with Invigorating Flow, a thoughtfully paced mixed-level class centered around a monthly theme. This practice blends mindful movement, alignment-focused postures, and skill-building exercises designed to both challenge and soothe, leaving you feeling vibrant, grounded, and connected. Suitable for all levels. 11:30am - 12:30pm | YOGALATES FLOW Discover harmony in motion with Yogalates Flow--a mindful fusion of yoga and Pilates that strengthens your core, glutes, and spine mobility. This session deepens your mind-body connection through slow, controlled movements, helping you build strength, flexibility, and centeredness in a balanced, holistic practice. Venue: 21/F, Yoga and Fitness Room, Wellness, Eaton HK About Karen: I have been exploring fitness and well-being since 2015. I’m passionate about helping others fill their own cups and finding stillness in motion. My classes are challenging, but also joyful and calm. I teach uncomplicated sequences in a slow, alignment-based flow, always incorporating meditation and a savoured savasana. *Kindly ask a member of staff on the G/F to let you up to the 21/F upon arrival **Please arrive 10 min before class. Participants may not be allowed inside after the class has started in order to avoid distubances to other participants.

title: Yoga Therapy and Ayurveda Teacher Training Certificate Course
summary: Breaks: Easter - 31 Mar - 7 Apr 2026. Class Schedule:1st March 2026 - 5th July 2026, Sunday (10:00am - 1:00pm & 2:00pm - 5:00pm)
organizer: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the heart
venue: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Who we are Anahata Yoga is a premier yoga center based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga. As a center, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity, but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle. Why us? We recognize that yoga is a popular pursuit in Hong Kong. People seek it out for its health benefits and often incorporate it into their active lifestyles. However, yoga instruction is not equal among the various yoga centers in Hong Kong. This is where our accredited Teacher Training Courses make all the difference. Our courses are accredited by, and offered in conjunction with, Asana Andiappan College of Yoga and Research Centre in India. This is the first time outside of India that such a program is being offered. Our classes are designed and taught in the same way as our instructors are taught. Predominantly from India, our instructors are fully learned not only in the practice of their discipline, but also in the history and philosophy behind the practice. The resulting combination of grassroots knowledge both practical and theoretical in our programs give students more in-depth learning than they may able to find elsewhere in Hong Kong.
